The happy hour is only available in the bar area or on half of the outside patio. Considering this is LAS VEGAS, if you're opening up happy hour on the outside patio, I'd hope you could spare some misters or working fans for the area.....or not. I guess we can just sweat it out/ overheat  -___-;;

Fine, if you're not providing us any cooling methods, at least make sure we have enough water? Is that too much to ask? Yes, it absolutely is. We had to flag down our waitress multiple times to get water. 

Not to mention, our waitress was not so coordinated - would drop items almost onto us. 

Finally, the food was really not that great.  Meh, I love the location and the idea, but I don't think we'll be coming back.
Great beer. Great wings. Great happy hour specials. Service was slow for a bit but that's fine, it was not bad enough to knock a star off
Yaaaaasssssssss!! Christian is amazing. I'm coming for the buffalo cauliflower and his awesome service. Thank you for the delicious experience.
Great service . Courtney was lovely and cute :) will return for the steak and Mac cheese .

I really liked this place. I went yesterday afternoon for brunch with old and new friends. There was 6 of us and we sat in an area of the restaurant that wasn't too crowded and had enough elbow room at the table to be comfortable. The service was good, and she was able to accommodate 6 different orders. I had the sausage and grits, which was very interesting because the grits were in a loaf somewhat, and not the country time grits style that I'm used to. It had corn, bacon, sausage, kale, tomatoes, eggs and that loaf that came together nicely. 

I changed the egg from fried to scrambled because no matter how hard I try fried egg just doesn't work for my taste buds. Their "almost bottomless" is a good deal, you can choose 4 drinks individually, or 4 of the same drinks for $10. The bloody mary came with a chicken wing, which I actually wasn't ready for and slightly confused, but it gave it a nice kick. Overall, this was a great place to meet up with friends, have a couple drinks, and eat good food.
Andrew and "girl" Ryan are amazing ! Fun, friendly bartenders, GREAT FOOD! Soo many beers to pick from!  I love the "school" atmosphere. The prices are great!! One of our new favorite spots !

Stopped by for dinner again. I love the cutting board and mushroom pizza! Perectly cooked and service was amazing! Wasn't a fan of the smoke on watermelon but they replaced it with the crushed velvet. Super awesome! I love it here and will be back soon!

None of the entree items actually sound enticing... They're over-priced, and flavors are meh. Gave it two tries, same impression both times. The theme of this restaurant is the most interesting thing about it.
They took all the good things off the menu, the staff has dwindled down, it started off great but the fizz has worn off

Went to check out Public School last Tuesday since I live right by Downtown Summerlin. The vibe was pretty chill and our waitress was cute & attentive. Got the cutting board as our appetizer but how could you mess up cheese, cold cuts and bread right?..Went with the pepperoni pizza as our main which was the biggest mistake of my life (gross, greasy and salty). Literally equivalent to eating Little Caesars that someone drenched with 2 lbs of oil. Was gonna complain but our waitress Courtney, but she recommended good wine so I liked her; plus I ate it all because I was dying of starvation. Conclusion: never order the pizza at Public School. We probably should have gone with the shrimp and grits our waitress recommended as the Summers Cabernet she recommended was good. 

Cheers!

This restaurant is very new. As a matter of fact I believe they opened two days ago. With that in mind I know it's a little early to be criticizing this restaurant.  When we got to the restaurant two girls battled over how to Seat us. Once we were seated we waited. We then continued to wait. We waited some more. My wife and I actually played a game where we would see how many waiters or waitresses would either pass by or look at us directly.  After about 10 minutes of just sitting there I told my wife if one more waiter walks by us we would leave. My wife was extremely embarrassed at this, but I had to put my foot down. Shortly after two waiters walked right past us as they talked to each other. We got up to walk out. As we walked out of the restaurant we both laughed. Not only did nobody notice we were leaving, but the greeter who had just seated us actually said thank you have a nice day. I know that this restaurant is fairly new so I won't talk about the food or drink. Oh yeah, we never got to that point. Not sure if we would ever go back to this place. It's just a weird situation to be honest. Doesn't the restaurant want to serve food and drink to its customers? Apparently not for public school (702).

Emily and Jason were amazing. My fiancé is allergic to mushrooms and we completely forgot to tell them no mushrooms. We were distracted talking about our wedding and forgot to mention to mushrooms. We told Emily we were so sorry and forgot to tell them no mushrooms. Without a problem after making a burger that had mushrooms, Jason was able to make a new one without any hesitation. I loved their energy. They were just concerned about my fiancé and trying to make sure he didn't take a bite of the burger that had mushrooms. Plus Jason had so much energy and passion. I worked in customer service and I can tell when someone enjoys their job and loves to make customers happy.

I have been SCHOOLED...and I liked it!

It was my sister's last night in town, and we decided to try something new.
She said it was one of the best meals of the trip, and I agree!

Everything was delicious!
We started with 3 appetizers - 
Mac & Cheese....sprinkled with potato chips! I know sounds weird, but was really great!
Bacon & Chedder Tater Tots.... Good flavor, the homemade ketchup was awesome. They were a tiny bit soggy and mushy. They lacked that wonderful tater tot crunch.
and Buffalo Cauliflower- Just...YES! Yummy!

We all loved our entrees. Chicken and waffles was a big hit! The flavor in the shrimp & grits was fantastic.

Over all we really had a great meal!

This was our first time coming to Public School 702 and it did not disappoint!!!  We were slightly skeptical because some of the reviews weren't very good but we absolutely loved it and I even told my husband I wanted to do a review because I loved it so much. We sat on the patio (in June after sunset) and it was very comfortable and a fun environment. We got the watermelon and heirloom salad stack which was refreshing and very flavorful. We also got the bison burger with fries and it was good sized and amazingly delicious. I would highly recommend this restaurant!!

I took the lunch group to Public School 702 in Downtown Summerlin today! It was so much fun. Great atmosphere. Our waiter was excellent! Everyone said their food was wonderful! Reminds me of the Yardhouse at Red Rock but the food is much better!

I love the decor of this place. It's themed like school. The menus are scantron and composite notebook themed & The napkins look like pieces of paper. 

For an appetizer we had the crispy buffalo cauliflower bites and those things were out of this world good! My entree was the CCB burger and that was packed so full of flavor, I couldn't get enough. Honestly everyone's meals looked so good. I can't wait to go back. It will be a new spot for sure!

This is a very eclectic environment. If you want to reminisce regarding your middle school or high school environment while you dine on delicious food, this is the place for you :-)
Each dish varies in price and quantity. But I've tried nearly everything on the menu and the chefs there do a phenomenal job. Their beer and wine selection is pretty extensive so be prepared to Peruse. 
They have indoor and outdoor seating. The indoor seating can be very lively. The outdoor seating provides a wonderful vista of the shopping plaza and is a perfect getaway for a date night for a dinner with a group of friends. They do have some outdoor games like chess, checkers, and oversize Jenga. Overall a wonderful place to eat in the staff is always professional and provides top quality service... As well as some details from your childhood civics class that you still may not know the answer to.

We had high hopes for this place... Great concept BUT horrible horrible service! Over and over and over again we tried this place and every time AWFUL service! Who has 8 bartenders behind the bar and 6 people at the bar and no one can get a drink? While one of the bartenders drinks a redbull, people wait to be helped. So we try again and sit outside at a table, once again no one would acknowledge us for (not exaggerating) almost an hour. No one would ask us if we needed a drink or food. Servers walk by over and over again. This place is a JOKE! Horrible! Horrible! Horrible service! An amazing concept... Great outdoor seating, great setup, this place honestly has a lot of potential.... But management needs to Fire their whole staff and try again!!!! Sadly a disappointment.

Jaimie was friggin awesome!!! This was only my second time here & the experience was phenomenal, everyone here carries a genuine smile, the food is amazing, and the mimosas are incredible! Jaimie, thank you for taking care of us!

The food is so reasonably priced for how unique and delicious it is. They have an amazing happy hour menu. Everyone who works there is so polite, patient, and strangely attractive... I love sitting outside because it can get a little loud inside, especially with the music.

The food was out of control good & we loved the brunch drink specials. We had the CCB and the Bison Burger. The tomato jam on the CCB was the best I've ever had. The service was amazing- our server Tyler was super knowledgeable about the menu and so on top of it. New fav spot

Awesome and fun place to eat. Really liked the admisphere.  The decor and the menu really took me back to the good old days  of school. The waiter that we had was a lot of fun. He gave us quizzes. Haha, loads of fun.
Love this place! Ahi tacos and buffalo cauliflower is my favorite!! Gets pretty busy for dinner so I suggest going early! Pizzas are huge.. Even the kids pizzas!

Went to Public School for the first time recently and had a really great experience. The public school theme was really cool. The menu was great. It had a lil something for everybody. The food we ordered was wonderful. Our server was extremely attentive. Our food came out super quickly. I ordered a guavalajara cocktail and it was one of the best cocktails I've ever had. My only criticism of the whole experience was that the bar took FOREVER to get our drinks to us. However, our server ended up comping a glass of wine to make up for the wait so I can't be too annoyed. I will definitely be going back and recommending to friends.
Great food!!!!! The only thing, they don't filter their water. How hard is it to get reverse osmosis so that I don't have to bring my own water? Hopefully...

Colby was great. He was attentive and made sure we were happy! He is the only reason for this 5 star. The chicken and waffles won at our table. The lamb burger was good not great. And the steak with mushroom salad, our mid rare steak was cooked properly but the arugula didn't do the plate justice ( also the portion of greens was off for the price.)

I came  to Public School 702 on a Wednesday night with my cousin. We had just finished watching a movie so we decided to check it out. The restaurant was easy to find and the host at the front was friendly. They have outdoor and indoor seating. We wanted to sit outside but the host informed us that we would have to wait so we opted to sit inside to avoid the wait and check out the restaurant's decor.

Being a high school teacher, I absolutely adored the restaurant's decor. It was decorated with school memoriabilia including trophies, books, etc. They also had an awesome solar system model hanging from the ceiling and other school themed canvases on the wall.The menus resembled composition notebooks which was a cute touch as well. The restaurant stayed true to its "public school" theme.

As far as the food, we were not super hungry so we decided to order small. We asked the server for recommendations and she was able to give recommendations for each category which was nice. However, being that we do not eat pork, there were limited options of what we could get in the entree section. Almost every dish has bacon in it, so if you love bacon, this is your place! The menu also seems to cater to an older crowd and seemed not so kid friendly. I did not see if there was a kid's menu but I'm assuming they don't have one since most of the people in the restaurant were 21+.

We ended up ordering the buffalo cauliflower along with the Irish stout braised  ribs. The buffalo cauliflower was actually pretty great. I am not a fan of cauliflower but it was perfectly breaded and tasted just like a buffalo wing. It was served with horseradish and buffalo sauce. I was okay with the buffalo sauce but absolutely hated the horseradish sauce. I figured they would at least have the option of ranch but the server said they did not serve ranch but they could offer aioli which I politely declined. I'm a ranch type of girl so I thought it was weird to have buffalo sauce flavored food without it. Regardless of the ranch though, the buffalo cauliflower is definitely one to try. The Irish stout braised ribs were also delicious. The runner for our food said it was the best entree on the menu and she was right! The meat was boneless and so tender. It paired up perfectly with the mashed potatoes served under it. I would definitely recommend ordering this dish!

The atmosphere of the restaurant itself is calm and seems sort of like a lounge. Our server was pleasant but took a while bringing us our check after we had asked for it. She stood by another table talking for almost 5 minutes so it was irritating to wait when we had asked for it before that. Once we got our check, we saw that our meal came out to about $30 for the two dishes, which was not too bad I guess. The only issues I have with this place is not having ranch but also the server giving us our check late. Other than those two issues, the place was nice to try and had tasty food! I'm giving it 3 stars because although it was good and a great place to try, I don't know if I'll come back again by choice.

Came here with a big group of friends after we left Pkwy tavern since they were charging a fee to get in if you didn't reservations due to the rousey fight.  

Service was great.  Our waiter was very attentive since there was like 14 of us.  The drink were really good, I recommend the pear necessities. The food however wasn't really up to par for what they were charging.  The pizza was greasy and pretty bland even for ordering 3 different types of pizzas. French fries were good, the hot wing like cauliflower was okay. 

The decor and theme was interesting. Totally forgot about the solar systems we used to do for class. Overall, place is very hipster but it made for a good back up plan but closed too early for being a Friday night.  We ended up hopping over to dave and busters.

3 1/2 stars

Great atmosphere. Very fun and great attention to detail. I just feel like I over paid for semi good food. It's not bad, so I don't want to over state it. And, it's priced in line with most similar restaurants. I just tend not to end up at these types of places.

Very solid four stars. Our food was excellent and five stars were possible if not for the smallish portion of salmon on one entree.  Shrimp and grits were 5 stars. $17 and a very hearty portion. Interesting presentation with the grits in a cake like state at the bottom of the bowl. Very tasty. Excellent beer selection. Very good service. There is beautiful patio seating, however, we did know about it when we got there and sat inside. Lighting was too bright for me in the  bar area.

This is the worst service I've ever had. Not once but three different times. Stay away, unless you have all day to spend waiting for drinks, like watered down alcohol, or enjoy having despicable customer service.

I was very excited to try Public School 702 at Downtown Summerlin!

This restaurant was very fun and charming- there is an overall schoolhouse theme! All the staff was pretty friendly and helpful

There was a group of four of us and we were not starving, so we decided to have a few things to share amongst us ....
- Bacon Cheddar Tots with a Sriracha ketchup- these were deep fried tator tots, with bacon and cheese inside, served with sirracha ketchup
- Chorizo Mac & Cheese- Emmental, cheddar, kale, sea salt & vinegar crunch
- Hand tossed pizza- house pepperoni- Mozzarella, provolone, crushed tomatoes, jalapeños

I really enjoyed all of our choices and would order them again!

We've been there several times and PS702 will be a regular stop for us! The food is creative and well executed. They offer an impressive tap list without overwhelming you with just "more". The Roasted Beet Salad is worth the trip in and of itself with the Crispy Cauliflower and Shrimp-n-Grits a close second. We've really enjoyed everything we've tried. My only knock is the way the combined space echoes and amplifies sound. The dining section is very noisy when they're half-full and it's bordering on mind-numbing when full. Absolutely to be expected (enjoyed!) in the pub section but the carry-over into the dining area is overbearing. You'll thoroughly enjoy your meal / beverage but don't expect to have a memorable conversation over dinner.
came in again today and know matter what time of day it is or who is here I always get the same amazing service and the food is consistently amazing!

It is located in a beautiful location and the decor is beautiful too but that is it. Menu items are very common and food quality is very average. I wouldn't go there again simply because the price is way too high for the value.

I love gastropubs so I was thrilled to find a new one opened five minutes from my house. Service is great and almost everything I've tried has been fantastic! My favorites are the buffalo cauliflower and vegetarian chili (soup of the day). The only complaint I have is that the orange juice for brunch is extremely small, filled with ice, and no refills. It's only $3.50 so I'm not trying to fret about it, but if you're parched from the Vegas heat, I would recommend ordering something else; a beermosa would have been the better choice.

So I posted a review awhile back about this please and have enjoyed it in the past but I got to say the customer service tonight gets an F! I went to sit in the bar/patio area and watched after server upon server passed right by my group as if we didn't exist, I also saw a table next to mine being cleared by 5 employees, again not one checked in with my group. I am pretty disappointed in this as I have always recommended this place to friends and family but this will no longer be the case bad customer service ruins a reputation I hope that the employees and management of this joint realize it.

It's been a while since I've given a restaurant five stars.  This place is definitely worth coming back to, over and over again.  We decided to hit up their happy hour.  $5 apps and well drinks. You cannot beat that.  We had everything from their wings, Margarita flat bread, sliders, fried cauliflower, to Ahi tacos.  Nothing got left behind. We devoured it all.  I'm not a fan of cauliflower, in fact I've hated it since I was a kid.  My friend ordered it without me knowing.  When it came out, I grabbed one, again without knowing what it was and damn it was amazing!   Once you have one, you just cannot stop.  It definitely made me want to go home and make it.  That's how great it tasted.  The wings are awesome as well.  This will definitely be our new favorite spot. Can't wait to go back.

Decor: Very hip and modern, with the schoolhouse theme in mind. Scoreboards and globes straight out of geography class adorn the ceiling. There's even a ceiling made out basketball/volleyball court hanging above the bar. The place looks great for happy hour, especially with the NBA Finals going on. However...

Food and Service: I wish I had the opportunity to try some food. Hell, I wish I had the opportunity to even order food. My girlfriend and I sat down in the bar area tables during happy hour. We literally waited 15 minutes (I timed it) and not a single waiter or waitress stopped by and asked if we wanted water, drinks, food, etc. 

We walked out, with insult to injury added by the hostess telling us to "have a good day", seemingly unaware that we literally sat at the table staring at each other for 15 minutes.

I would absolutely love to come back, enjoy drinks and take in a sports event, but I shouldn't have to ask for service in the process.

Stumbled across the awesome spot while wandering downtown Summerlin. Even though they were busy they sat us quickly. Our server Melissa was great. Never ran out of water, checked in on us in reasonable intervals without being bothersome. Everyone was friendly and seemed to be enjoying where they worked. 

I ordered the flat steak with the chorizo Mac and cheese for my entree and we had the tater tots as an app. Those tots are feeling amazing. You will want to order more than just one order (it's seven in a single order, so if you don't want to end up in a fork war or having that awkward moment when there is only one left...) The steak was incredible. It came out exactly as I ordered it and no steak knife was necessary (which is an amazing accomplishment for the cooks, as flat iron steaks can be very tough.) There was just the right amount of truffle butter on top and just delicious. The mac was also very yummy. So much so that my mum decided she would just eat mine. 

Now for dessert! If you are a bacon lover, and who isn't? You need to order the Cookie ice cream sandwich! Right now! It is epic. I mean... Nutella spread, chocolate chip cookies, vanilla ice cream encrusted with BACON! and 6 bucks! 

I will definitely be returning when I'm back in Vegas.

Public School is a fun little gastropub with a great selection of food and beers. I'm from San Diego County, CA and was pleased to see some of my favorite brews from back home on their menu!

Their buffalo cauliflower is a MUST HAVE. The ambiance and service (Tyler was great!) really make the whole experience at Public School worth 5 stars.

I went here for the first time for happy hour with my wife, brother and sister-in-law. The venues in a really cool location in the Summerlin marketplace. Right above Fogo day ciao

The vibe is really cool, the music playing is alternative with a mix of top 40 and some old-school 90s tunes. The name and the Decour totally match;you walk in and you feel like you're in a science lab or library with chalkboards and comfortable seating. In the bar It's communal seating very long tables with 10-12 stools on either side.  I would coin this as a bar, not a sports bar there was only one TV in the bar that I could see so if you want to watch the basketball games, you'll have to go someplace else. We sat in the bar for only about five minutes, before we even ordered drinks because they were going to allow us to have happy hour on the outdoor patio, which is delightful, great atmosphere, not as noisy as inside, the weather was warm and helpful service.

The first look; the menus were notebooks you would see in college, they had a small clipboard as well as a happy hour menu. The happy hour menu had 8 to 10 food options along with some wine and beer.  They also had well drink specials to.

I tried just about everything on the appetizer menu, and was disappointed the ahi poke was bland, the PB&J sliders wasn't explained to me that that was actually a hamburger slider with peanut butter and jelly, just didn't go together for our tables liking. My wife loves pizza, so she ordered the margarita pizza, which didn't have enough cheese on it. The pizza sauce was a little spicy which both my wife and I like. I'm a huge hummus fan and was excited to try a white bean hummus to know what that really was, it was OK it needed a little salt to increase the flavor, just to me tasted flat. 

There was no salt-and-pepper on the tables, I try to get a hold my waiter "Brandon" it wasn't his fault. I wanted to tell Brandon that the appetizers were mediocre at best and return the pb&j sliders but it was "good Friday" and I didn't want to be too picky and "thankful" but I had 6 appetizers and not one stood out. Oh that's  not true, I did try the fried cauliflower which was probably the most appetizing appetizer.  The service was very good they leave a water bottle at your table so I don't have to keep asking the waiter every time to fill my water glass cup, I really like that.

I wouldn't go back there for any of their food, if their happy hour appetizers are so boring I wouldn't expect the food to be any better. I would go back for a drink or have a glass of wine with my wife (no food), the brewery across the street at the redrock Casino has far better appetizers and 10 times the amount of choices. 

Right before our party of four left I had to make a quick stop in the bathroom, I came out and did see one of the chalkboards talking about their specials I know there was a few errors I'm probably being too picky here but they said their beers for $4-7, I didn't see any beers on the menu that were $4, management should update their signage to properly address that the happy hour menu says.

Great service and delicious food. My friends and I came in for brunch and let me say I love this place. Everything was flavorful and came out quickly. Plus $10 for almost bottomless mimosas is such a deal.
I've only had an appetizer once. We usually come for drinks. Nice patio. Just found out they have a brunch.

This place was the bomb, and several Yelpers and I went after an event.

Great beers, and great company.  Haven't tried the food yet, but would love to do it.   What's awesome though are the people.  The wait staff is actually amazing.  Granted that it was a Monday night and there wasn't too much going on but there's not many times that a waiter is walking past, and we're talking about dating sites... and he just enters in the answer to the question we had.

I mean, that's what you can call service!

What can you say?   The live music was decent.   The only thing that I think they need to do is to drive a bit more traffic on the off-nights.   Perhaps there might be a Yelp event in the future here?

Hard to say.  I'm just saying....  if the staff that served us, did the tables for a Yelp event.. you know it'll be great.

The first time we attempted to try this place, we had to wait for 45 minutes. So, we decided not to and just come back next time. We finally made it on a Sunday brunch. Overall, it was ok. Service is a little slow and I don't know why the servers keep bringing food and asking if it's your order. No organization what food to which table? Bringing food we didn't order. Server passed by to our table and brought our order to the table next to us then came back to us. I'll review the food we ordered. Sorry no pictures :(.
#1 Calamari: 4 stars. good and not greasy
#2 Ahi tuna crunchy tacos: 5 stars. our favorite, nice combinations of flavors and the crunch
#3 Orange juice: 5 stars. so refreshing and mellow tartness of the citrus. 
#5 Fish and chips: 1 star for fish. I'm always on search of good fish and chips. And I thought I'll find the good one here but nope. I don't like too much breadings on fish since they get to oily. We felt like we were eating oil instead of fish. 5 stars on the chips. Crunchy, not oily and perfectly seasoned. 
#6 Kids mac n cheese: 5 stars. Kid and parents approved. 
#7 Nutella cookie ice cream sandwich: 3 stars. Chewy cookies with a nice crunch outside. It has some bacon bits to add a little salty contrast on all the sweetness. It's good but nothing to dream about. 

This place got a nice ambiance. The menus, napkins and decors are very cool. Coming back?  Maybe.

My friend, who is a Vegas and Summerlin local suggested that we check out Public School because it has a cool vibe to it and it was in the new plaza that was built. 

We came in around 9PM on a Sunday night and it wasn't too busy. The hostess told us that we could sit anywhere in the bar area, so we grabbed a table and menus were brought to us almost immediately. Our server then came out with a bottle of water and two cups for us. 

I loved the ambiance here because it was super cute and hipster-like. I felt like this would be a place I could find somewhere in Portland. The decor mirrors that of a classroom, so you have yearbooks, dictionaries, encyclopedias, math cards, and all that jazz around the restaurant. The menus itself look like composition notebooks and the theme is followed through to every aspect of the venue. 

We got the Citra Rye Pale Ale. Now, I'm not much of a beer drinker, but this had a lychee and grapefruit scent that followed the bitterness of the beer, which was nice. I thoroughly enjoyed it, and it wasn't even expensive! $5 for a glass of this goodness. Perhaps this will be my step towards developing a taste for beer. 

We then ordered a brown bag of fries. The fries were perfectly cooked and came with Siracha Ketchup and mustard BBQ sauce. The ketchup overpowered the Siracha so you can smell the Siracha, but the taste of it is very faint. The mustard BBQ sauce almost tastes like honey bbq. Quite interesting.

We also got The Cutting Board, which was an assortment of artisan cheeses and cured meats. We had a goat cheese, blue cheese, and sheep cheese with prosciutto and salami. There was also cashews, jam, onions, and other little things on the board with toasted artisan bread thinly sliced in the middle. All very interesting and tasty. It's chef's choice, so this probably changes from day-to-day. 

I loved the atmosphere of this place and how cool everything is. I'll definitely want to visit again next time I come into town.

The food is amazing. A lot of drinks to choose from. It's really awesome they have jenga and beer pong. I docked major stars and would give service alone 1 star. Our waitress karissa was horrible. Sat down and waited ten minutes to get drink orders. She forgot to get my sons order. As she took our drink orders she goes over and talks to another worker for about five minutes then finally goes outside to her other table. I understand when people are busy but she was talking half the time and seemed like she could give two shits. I will give this place another try but maybe for drinks with friends. 
Also it's weird they have steak but no a1 or steak sauce? They brought BBQ sauce??! Even fine dining steak houses and chillis have a1 I mean come on. At least a busser , of course not the server she was Mia, had the courtesy to bring out some kind of sauce for my husband.

Came here for the opening day and again a week later. Everything was delicious. Food came out quick and the servers were very friendly! Cocktails and beer were exceptional. Loved the atmosphere and the interior design. Many people here are complaining about slow service and I'm not sure why. Public School is a band new restaurant they are still settling in so its expected to have a hick up here and there. Will definitely be back!

went here today during happy hr. it was our first time here.  its a big restaurant, cool decor too.  happy hr prices were pretty good, everything ranged from $5-7 items. we tried the naked wings, fries, margharita pizza and adobo tacos.  i would repeat all except the tacos; bland and boring for being one of the more expensive items on their hh menu. 
yes, food was good. however service was horrendous. our waitress took 15 min to get us water! we still didnt order yet after 15 min...  we ordered a beer n diet coke. we got a beer and a coke, not diet.  when we mentioned it to her, she gave us the heavy breath look like it was our fault n it would be a huge problem to go back n get the diet coke since it was the actual glass bottles. we said forget it n let it be. but u really have to enjoy the annoyed look u get for their mess up.  btw, we got 2 of our apps before our beer and wrong soda. thats how long she took!  
there are many runners bringing out food from the kitchen. we were also lucky to get the one runner who dropped the lemon aioli from the fries dish off the table, narrowingly missing my wife's shirt n pants. she was apologetic, but never replaced the aioli.  we had to ask for it when another runner came by.  
overall, ok... beer is good, food is good, atmosphere is good....service is NOT GOOD!

Great food, good service. Came in for a first visit and was definitely inpressed. The menu is a touch fancy but ask for a recommend item and you wont be disappointed. 

Our server Sheri was legit, ( had to ask to spell her name, and thats the only thing we needed. ) 

Even the frys are good. Soda comes in a glass bottle ( coke ) which i prefer as it is made with real sugar!  

The sauces and specials are house made, and tons of good rotating beers on draft. We will return

Went for late lunch on a Wednesday. Service was excellent. The BBQ Bison Burger had that authentic char-broiler taste with just a touch of not too sweet bbq sauce and emmental cheese. The Wild Mushroom & Taleggio Pizza had a bold and earthy mushroom taste. Fries are served with Sriracha ketchup. Besides their regular tap beers, they have a rotating list of about twelve or fifteen first rate drafts.

Mom and I decided to try out one of the new restaurants in Downtown Summerlin.  This looked like a cool place so we decided to eat here.  The place is decorated like a school with books and the solar system.  Very cute concept.  Seems like it would be a fun place at night hanging out in the bar.

We started with diet cokes.  They brought us very small bottles.  Not sure if this means you have to pay for refills.  I had the Colorado Lamb Burger with tomato cranberry jam, arugula, brie, brioche bun (I held the bun and had it wrapped in lettuce instead).  The burger was nice cooked.  Looked the brie, cranberry jam and arugula.  Yum!  Mom had the fish and chips.  She asked for cocktail sauce which they don't normally serve but they made it for her.  Fish was crispy on the outside, flaky instead.  Good flavor.  Mom loved the fries. 

We had good service with a friendly waitress. Definitely a cut place.  I am sure we will be back at some point.

WORST EXPERIENCE IN DINING I HAVE EVER HAD. 

I've been here one time before and was reluctant to try another dish a friend of mine had. From first experience the food isn't as great and the price does not fit the quality for most dishes. However the truffled steak and macaroni was a big hit to me and felt that, that was the only reason to come. The server (at the time) was a big sweetheart and was another reason why I wanted to share this restaurant with personal friends and family.

Well today was my mother's birthday. Knowing that their steak was great I was excited to bring her in for a try since she's already tried several yummy steakhouses (Fogo de Chao just below) plus and overall presentation of the restaurant is extremely creative! Which is the ONLY reason why I would give this place a star. 

I proceed in, and a woman with red hair who kind of reminded me of Ronald McDonald quickly frowns from her fake smile once we turn in. Ultimately I ignored it and didn't care to let one gesture ruin our night. I proceed to say "2 for balcony please." She leads us in right away and offers us any seat in the house and will aware the servers that we are here.

10 minutes later, not one server came. At this point I was losing patience. Several server goes by and not one acknowledges us. I had enough time to have a conversation to reserve a dinner at fogo de chau and ultimately ashamed that I brought my mother in here. Being the sweet woman she was, she agreed that we should just leave. Not only did this place ruin a birthday dinner but was rude in every single way. Will not becoming here any longer. 

On side note: maybe if she apologized when she clearly saw us leaving, I might have reconsidered the whole situation but she instead rudely smirked as we left.
Julian was awesome! It's rare to find servers that make your day. Great beer selections and a solid crowd turn out for Sunday Funday!

Third visit. Great patio, decent sports bar food but MIND NUMBING LOUD inside!  Not worth it if you can't sit outside.  Also, there's almost always a wait for outside and frankly even on their best day this place is not worth a wait. Not recommended.

OMG they introduced a new entree to the brunch menu. Pecan crusted french toast it is indescribable. Not to sweet, but the grilled peach with a sweet cheese is amazing to finish the plate. I love how the chefs use their creative  imagination and in depth palate to make such a dish. Two thumbs up!! I am looking forward to the winter menu. Matt was our waiter and he made the brunch a blast. He was attentive, on the ball with everything we needed. He really enjoys his job and his new home in Las Vegas.

Solid spot, great draft selection! Lots of good local beers offered. They don't kill people on the prices either, i would come here more often but it's kind of a far drive. Food was decent, but the service was spot on and our waiter was really cool.
Cool place. Nice location. Nice draft beer list. Food was solid. Short menu but well thought out. Better than most restaurants for this price.
Great food and friendly service. We waited age for the mains to come out and the restaurant wasn't that busy. We only ordered salads so I'm not sure what the hold up was. I would still recommend.

Fun atmosphere, decor is "school" themed. I love the outside patio with giant jenga a beer pong tables.

We ordered the Tuscan chopped salad; kale, tomatoes, soppressata, burrata, crispy prosciutto. Per the menu it was also supposed to have chickpeas but out of the whole salad we were only able to find one (seriuosly, one!). But overall it was good, and a good size portion for sharing. The pizza we ordered was basic margherita, it was ok. The crust is thin which I like, but almost too thin towards the center so when you pick up a slice you have to fold it. I think it could have been cooked a bit longer? 

We had an awesome server, Erin. She was really hustling for us. Our group was ordering a lot of drinks, she was on top of it and she checked with us very frequently. So aside from Erin, heres the kinks; the drink service could really use some work. It took a looooong time to get drinks. To give an idea, we sat down and ordered drinks right away. After about 5 min we were ready to order food. Our food came out before we had even gotten our drinks!? This isnt the servers fault, they just need a better system at the bar. New place so it takes time. Overall I like this place and I would recommend checking it out.

I came in for brunch the other day and it was great! The service was quick and food tasted great, thank you Vanessa! My favorite was the eggs Benedict pizza. The atmosphere was bright, clean, and the public school theme was fun. We even planned to come back for brunch next week!

Once again we got top shelf service. The deep fried cauliflower is great. The Checkoslovakian beer on tap is fantastic. I had the Ahi Tuna Poke and my son had the pepperoni and jalapeño pizza. Food was fresh and great. All the servers who helped us were so friendly and happy. Second time we have had Amelia provide excellent customer service. She obviously loves her job. Haylie also provided great service with a smile. We will keep coming back.

Heard about the place, so we decided to try it out. We went in about 8 PM tonight.  Had to wait a few minutes for a table.  The lady that helped us was very nice.  Sadly she was the last staff member that spoke to us.  Sat at the table waiting to have someone stop by and maybe take our drink order but we never had a wait staff  member stop by.  Had several wait staff walk by but they never said a word or made eye contact with us.  They waited on the tables on both sides of us.  I can't recommend the place.  When asked I will let everyone know how bad our experience was.  Don't waste your time, we had dinner at another place close by and it was great.

Went for dinner with a group of 7 for a friend's party. We had a reservation and were promptly seated to our table inside. The restaurant itself is huge and has a fun schoolhouse vibe to it. 

Our server was very attentive. As soon as we sat at the table, she greeted us kindly and offered to take our drink orders while we waited for our entire party to arrive. Throughout our dinner she continued to check in on us and kept the drinks flowing. 

The FOOD!!!! Because many in our group were first timers to PS702 we decided to order everything center-table, family style. So glad we did, we were able to taste a good portion of the menu and leave with full and happy tummies! What we ordered...

Appetizers:
Crispy Buffalo Cauliflower - My favorite out of the apps. Breaded and fried to perfection with a side of blue cheese aioli and buffalo sauce.
Crispy Ahi Tuna Tacos - While they were good, there really wasn't anything special about them. One order will give you 4 tacos.
The Cutting Board - A very generous sized charcuterie board with a tasty selection of meats and cheeses. One board was large enough for our entire party to try. 

Entrees:
Shrimp & Grits - One of my favorite plates of the night! A ton of flavor and a nice portion.
Short Rib - So tender and paired with horseradish mashed potatoes.
Flat Iron Steak w/ Truffle Butter - I love anything truffle, but I didn't really taste it. The plate did come with chorizo mac and cheese which was the highlight of my night! 
Jidori Chicken & Waffles - The entire dish was so flavorful! The chicken was juicy and cooked perfectly. 
Lamb Bolognese - My least favorite dish of the night... Don't order, try the above entrees instead! 

I will definitely return! Maybe for their brunch!?!!

Had a very fun time here. The energy was uplifting and positive as the servers all looked to be enjoying their job. The service was outstanding. Amanda was our server and she made our time spent there very pleasurable. She was very knowledgable about the menu and drinks, and was more than willing to explain items as well as offer beer samples. The grilled watermelon was excellent. Had a burger which was cooked just the way I ordered it. I can see this eatery only getting better. They are off to a great start. Will return!!

My boyfriend and I have been wanting to come to Public School 702 for some time. Saw great things on the website; creative concept, great craft cocktails, and an amazing beer list. That would deserve a 5 in itself. Although, unfortunately our service could have used a 1 star. The bartender made our drinks, gave us our bill, and went and sat down to dinner. Not once were we asked how our drinks were or if we wanted another. We took our drinks down, left some cash at the bar and walked out. Didn't hear a single goodbye or thank you come from the three staff members huddled around each other.

Great place! Love the decor and food. They executed the school theme well with the composition book menus and homework togo boxes. Very clever! I had the bison burger, and it was delicious ! The meat was tender and cooked to perfection! The side of fries were excellent as well and i really enjoyed the siracha ketchup. I also recommend their house pepperoni pizza. It has a thin, crunchy crust, and is topped with fresh jalapeños and incredible pepperoni. This is great place to come with friends, especially during "recess" AKA happy hour. Definitely will be returning to public school 702!
The food is great and the service is hit or miss. I try to avoid busy times because it is a long wait. They have good Mac and cheese and a great variety of drinks.

Great decor and waitress was very attentive so that's the three stars.  Food was boring.  Frito dish was suppose to be chili over Fritos with cheese and pickled  jalapeños.  It was just taco meat over Fritos with a little cheese cream sauce.  Very dry and uninspired.   Sliders were tiny dry burger rounds on oversized buns.   Chorizo Mac and Cheese was excellent.

Great food and service! The Buffalo Cauliflower was amazing as well as the house pepperoni pizza! Peter Rodriguez was our server and pretty much completed our experience. Great evening, I'll definitely be back soon!

This place was really really good!!!!! We got the tots, calamari, huntsman burger, and the ccb. We also tried the temperanillio wine, a local IPA beer, and this blackberry Moscow mule type of drink. Everything came out in a timely manner, the interior was beautiful, and all of the food was amazing!
My only complaint was the soggy burger bun, and everything was a bit pricy for what it was but this restaurant is a very typical hipster restaurant.

Overall I will be back to try the rest of the beer and to try everything else!

They messed up my order after I repeated it several times. I said no bacon but they still brought out bacon and giving them the benefit of the doubt I started eating only to realize the bacon on my burger. I am not going back
Friendly people's/employee's. Yelp labeled them as a pool house. They have no pool tables But they have beer pong tables and shuffle boards and jenga.

Love this place , the games they have outside are cool and they have a mini shuffleboard. Staff was friendly and server was awesome.
Their pizzas are off the chain!

As always, lunch was great and the service was top notch. Jess did a great job and was very personable and knowledgeable of all the items on the menu!!! Can't wait to come back after work and have a few beers!!!

Great new restaurant at Downtown Summerlin. Food is good, nice craft beer list and unique spins on the traditional cocktail. The atmosphere inside and out is fun with beer pong, big jenga, shuffleboard and TVs. Service can be a little slow at times and if you sit by the bar it will be loud.

The food was pretty good, there is this awesome citrus beer. But what makes this place truly special is by far one of the best wait staff that I have experienced in Vegas.  Grace is soo attentive and knows the menu backwards and forwards and certainly gives wonderful recommendations!

Food was good enough to warrant a return in the future. Service was ok, the two of us stood for a few minutes when we first arrived and the restaurant was not super busy, but they had us seated within 5 minutes. The hamburger was awesome. Ground chuck, super tender and juicy with an egg. Can't beat it. Beers are a little on the spendy side, and I didn't like the one I ordered, so probably won't be doing that again. Not for 8 bucks anyway. The bacon cheddar tots were really good, don't even tell me what the calorie count was! Don't need to know!

I would love to give this restaurant 5 stars, because not only do I love the food and the beer selection, I love the atmosphere. But I've gone there on three different occasions and have had rude, rude, rude extremely rude service. Not only by a server, but a bartender and a manager. I will definitely start logging names because as an employee in the service industry myself I can't believe how entitled the employees are when a customer isn't happy with their meal or is just asking questions. My fiancé and myself had a manager laugh in our faces when we had a question regarding the menu and wanted the price to be adjusted based on how it was described.
There really needs to be a little customer service training for all the employees and managers. Employees, guest and customers alike need to understand quality customer service comes from quality customers and severs. I hope sooner than later the quality of service changes because it's actually a great place in a great location especially to have such shitty service and managers!!!

It's like dating someone really pretty with no substance. Attractive on the outside, but super disappointing on the inside. Service sucks- super slow, rude and did I mention they're super slow? The food and drinks were decent when we finally got them, but not enough to bring me back. We had to walk up to the register to pay our check, then we walked over to CPK where they had excellent, friendly and attentive service. Take notes, Public School.

Great location.  I enjoyed the food,  although my husband wasn't impressed will his frito pizza.   It's very up close and personal.  The guests sit very close to one another.  The music is ridiculously loud,  so you can't hear what the person next to you is saying.  I guess that could be good or bad,  depending on who you are with.   I liked my party of 4, so felt the "noise" was a bit much.  It looks like they are going for a young crowd, with the music and noise, but attract a variety of ages.... they should consider toning it down to fit into their clientele.

Food was good. Service was below par. Actually service sucked. We saw the waiter maybe 4 times and 3 of those times were when he gave us the menu, took our order, and closed us out. He was so bad and so unattentive that someone else closed our check out.

I was bummed about our experience, especially since I've had coworkers talk about this place. The two hostesses looked and acted like we were bothering them when we walked in. Took our server 5 min to come get our drink order, even though he was standing 2 feet away, chatting with the other servers the whole time. Plus, the restaurant wasn't very busy. (Management should probably send people home when you have a group of 5 or so standing by the bar chatting the whole time we were there.) I'd probably go back to try some other dishes cause the food was good, but rude employees really deter me from returning to a place.

Do not eat here if you want to be able to converse with others at your table. It is club loud up in there. Not sure why they do that. You have to scream to communicate with anyone. I'll never come back because I like to actually interact with my dining companions. Food is ok. Service is barely acceptable.
Okay food, nice environment, average service at about $35 person. Might go back again next year for a second chance!

Food and service is amazing! We are the only ones outside but get checked up on frequently. The food came out at a very great timing! Jaimie is an amazing server! Shout out to her for her amazing service! The food is great! Would definitely recommend!
I love going to this bar. Always great and fast service! The deep fried cauliflower is amazing! And Christian and Sheri give the best bar service! Love this place. Highly recommended!!!!
Decent neighborhood place in Summerlin. Convenient location. Food is ok, but limited menu.

We tried Public School 702 shortly after they opened for business.

We started with a couple of appetizers. I didn't love the calamari, but I typically don't enjoy fried calamari so that wasn't too surprising. The tater tots were the highlight of the appetizers. 

For an entree I ordered the cobb burger and chose the kale and brussel sprout slaw. When my food came they had given me fries instead, but quickly noticed their error and brought me the slaw. The burger was cooked perfectly and the flavors were great. Lots of bleu cheese and drippy egg and the slaw was on point as well. I enjoyed my meal quite a bit. 

The service was very attentive. Some were a bit overzealous since the restaurant just opened but I appreciated the extra effort. 

I'd be interested in coming back to try more of their menu and possibly happy hour some
Time soon.

First visit to Public School. I was eagerly awaiting the opening. Just ordered an ice tea and the Shaved Brussel Sprout Salad for a light bite. Salad was loaded with blue cheese, super yummy. Highly recommend. I'll be back for more!

I am sad to report that my second visit was not as amazing as my first. I really hope this was just an off night at Public School 702, because I really love the ambiance and live music on weekend nights. 

I was feeling like pasta with a meaty red sauce, so I ordered the bolognese. But it had a very strange flavor and atypical meat sauce. I think the only reason I ate it without complaint was due to the utter mortifying food experience and all around bad day my friend was having.

The chef made things right though by making me an off the menu light salad. The poached pears with mixed greens and prosciutto salad topped with candied pecans and goat cheese was really really good!! I would come back just to have this salad.

For dessert, I had the lemon meringue with a graham cracker bottom. The dessert looked absolutely scrumptious. The meringue was super good, but the lemon custard was way too sweet for my palate. I had to cut the sweetness between sips of my dark roast and otherwise bitter coffee.

The restaurant was clean and the staff was friendly. Because my two experiences were very different from one another, I am sure I will come for another visit in the near future.

I have gone here for brunch on 2 occasions, and both times have been simply wonderful. I ordered the chicken sausage grits with the "just about bottomless" mimosas. First off, the grits were like heaven in my mouth. Crispy on the outside and soft, perfect texture on the inside. This alone made me want to come back for more. Secondly, the mimosas were delicious. For brunch they actually have several drinks options you can choose from - mimosas, beermosas, bloody Mary's, or michelada - and you can have 4 of them in any combination you'd like for just $10, which I can say is more than plenty! The staff were friendly on both occasions and the atmosphere was great for socializing. There are also TV's for those people who want to get their football fix.

All I can say is WOW!!! Awesome food. Great service. The beer selection and variety is SWEET!! Delicious food. Don't pass this place up. Unique food with unbelievable flavors. It will definitely be on your favorites list.
The service isn't great and it's a pretty noisy restaurant. The food looks hopeful on the menu but the taste doesn't deliver. Its overrated in my opinion and is more trendy than anything else.
Great atmosphere... GREAT Happy Hour Menu and prices...great service...definitely coming back and this place will be on my Happy Hour rotation :  )
I love the atmosphere-everything has a school like theme. You're also allowed to sample a beer before you buy it, which is great. Pretty crowded during HH but a fun place to check. Out.

Had to check out this new cool place (like Yard House) but better atmosphere. The service at the bar was very attentive at lunch time. My chicken sandwich was crispy, with lots of good stuff inside. Overall, I would return.

Josh (in the Guinness hat circa 2009) was OK...

But the cauliflower was decent. Wish they had ranch, Josh suggested we go to Wolfgang Puck instead

I was given a gift certificate to Public School and was excited to go.  I was not impressed.  They had a great beer selection, but charged about double what any other place in town charges for premium beers in a bottle.  Not many beers to choose from for their cheaper beers.  The menu was very limited and expensive.  Cheapest burger was $13 and then only a couple to choose from. We ate in the bar which was mainly a sports bar.  3 different TVs going.  Very noisy. Service was good and the food was ok.  I will only go back because I have a little more left on the gift certificate, but when that is done, I won't be back.

The gastropub scene with it's craft brews and tricked out Mac and cheeses is getting quickly saturated and fiercely competitive, leaving you grasping for differentiators to accurately recall where you dined the night before. 
 The beer itself won't do it anymore, nor will a quirky bacon wrapped or jammed fare. 
 The upstairs patio set up at Public School makes for a nice atmosphere reminiscent of Southern California, so good job there. 
 The beer selection doesn't hurt either. 
 Food is rather predictable, though still delicious and interesting to look at. 
 I decided to throw caution to the wind and go with lamb burger, laden with delicious, fatty, juicy calories, minus bun, plus quinoa salad. While the delicious fat made the burger...delicious, quinoa salad was very meh. I make better? No? You come my house, I feed you. 
 Here is my gripe. Yes, we were a group of 22. Yes, it's a PIA. But, we did have a reservation. So ok, can't put tables together- fine, three adjacent tables are totally cool. But not two waiters working at two VERY different speeds and on different schedules, completely independently of each other, except for coordinating the bill. So here it is- while I'm just putting my order in, my coworkers at the other table are getting their food delivered. A bit extreme, if you ask. So they have to wait and stare us down,  while we tuck the napkins into our collars. 
 Otherwise, everything went seamlessly. No special urge to go back.

Great place. My friend and I walked in, sat at the bar and we were promptly taken care of by Bryan. He informed us of the happy hour specials, and made us delicious cocktails all night. He's a great mixologist. Great service at the bar.

Next time will try the food and outdoor fun.

Great beers, bartenders don't know anything about the beers. The menu is ok. Not bad to pair beer with. The bartenders aren't very friendly. Ask for Simon if you do come in. They do have a good happy hour menu for food and beer.

Daaaamn ps702! Back at it again with the good food! Sorry I had to. Haha. But we're back again and this time I got their skirt steak and chorizo Mac and cheese. My boyfriend got a bison burger. The steak was cooked to medium just how I like it. It melted in my mouth and the Mac and cheese was pretty good but a bit too salty. My boyfriend enjoyed his burger but didn't really touch his fries so I finished it off for him hah. I'll have  to come back for drinks next time though.

I saw pictures of a mythical dessert called Nutella Cookie Sandwich. For a week, I've been imagining what it could possibly taste like and feel like until I've finally decided to try it.

By the entrance is a glass display with sports trophies, Pom poms, Michael Jordan lunchbox, algebra book, calculus book and all things that would remind you of school minus the nun that smacks your hand with a ruler because this is Public School 702. You just get budget cuts.

The menu would remind you of a notebook and the napkins would remind you of a notepad. Blackboards on the wall and the moon and planets above your head. Hipsters with their glasses, beards, sleeve tats and a beer. 90's hip hop playing in the background.

We tried the grilled salmon, bison burger, chicken and waffles and the Nutella Cookie Sandwich. The entrees were just ok. The bison burger had a nice spicy kick to it but I also almost had an anaphylactic reaction because of an ingredient that wasn't on the menu description but was somehow in burger. The fries were not great.

The Nutella Cookie Sandwich would be the only reason I'd come back here. So, you get chocolate chip cookies with Nutella schmeared on the flat side of the cookies, vanilla ice cream in the middle with a wall of bacon brittle. "I got 5 on it"...yup, it's only $5 that's big enough for 2-3 people.

The service could use remedial lessons.

First time here and enjoyed the bottomless mimosas and the  calamari, for my entree ordered the huntsman burger and couscous salad everything was very delicious. Great prices and fun interesting restaurant, will definitely be back.

Dinner at the bar was enjoyable- nice bartenders and really quick service! Had my order for buffalo cauliflower and the Asian noodle salad in 5-10 minutes after ordering. The happy hour special is great for apps and drinks. The cauliflower was tasty and would perfect as a shared app before a meal. Asian salad was good with shrimp and chicken- had fresh flavors with mango and mint. Great healthy option, but not what you want if you want a really really yummy entree. I was told by a regular to order their pizza next trip in. Great vibe for casual date or hanging out with friends!

Let me start by saying I have eaten here several times. And while no meal was ever perfect, some were definitely better than others. When the service has been great, the food has been mediocre. When the food has been awesome, the service has lacked, and ultimately, I think the service in general leaves alot to be desired. The past few times we have dined there, we weren't greeted promptly, had to wait an unusual amount of time for drinks, or been left without refills for the entire meal, and the food has been a solid three star rating. We do have our favorites on the menu, like the buffalo cauliflower and the charcutterie platter, which have been consistently good. The chicken and waffles, however, has been consistently bland, and sometimes downright bad. The fish and chips is a safe choice, and usually pretty good. The burgers are always hit or miss, and just tonight, we ordered the shorty bowl, which was pretty good, but the egg was cold, and cold runny egg yolk is not my favorite, by far.

I want this place to be better than it is, and at this point, given the cost of the entrees and the lackluster food and service that feels like the staff just doesn't care, I don't think it will be in our rotation any more.

We love this restaurant and bar! Super cool vibe and great food. Just spent a great afternoon with Matt and Connor- could not be more informed about the beer on tap or great cocktails. Come here, meet them, drink and eat lots.

Went in for lunch. Their lunch menu is really scaled down, which is understandable. 
Had the Mac and cheese, which is one of the better recipes I've tried in town. Their fry sauces are one of a kind and delicious. Also tried one of their specialty lavender cocktails, which was delightful for the senses. My companion enjoyed his hot dog and complimented the beer selection. 
We sat for quite some time before our drink order was taken and it seemed they had a brief staff meeting as we were trying to get our check cashed, so my lack of one star on this rating pertains to speed of service. Luckily, we weren't on a time crunch, but if we were, I would not go back here for a quick lunch.

First time here today with a group of friends for Valentine's Brunch! The theme of Public School is so darn cute! From the blackboard/chalk writings on the walls, their composition menus, binder paper napkins, and more! Such a fun theme especially for adults, getting that feel of old school memories while drinking some beers from the bar. Anyway, great vibes. I especially love that after eating inside, our group went to their outside patio and played some beer pong, life size connect 4 and life size Jenga! We came in and stayed from 11am-4pm. 

Oh shoot I totally forgot to mention the food!!! Anyway, food was awesome! LOVED their chicken & waffles!! Gotta have that for brunch. Also great to share! My boyfriend got the stuffed French toast so we shared with each other. His order was a little too much on the sweeter side than I prefer, but it was still good! Our whole group also got bottomless mimosas - which carried us onto the outside patio for more drinks to come haha. 

~~~ in my update for my review I just wanted to give a shout out to the service my friends and I received today. Honestly I always feel so terrible whenever I go to restaurants with a large group. I understand how large groups could be difficult esp in a setting where drinks are involved.. well today Emilia was our waitress and the entire time, she was super happy, energetic and just really took care of us (keep in mind our group was about 23 people) even when things were getting complicated, esp at the end when we were handling the check and everyone wanted to split it, she never showed that she was bothered or stressed. I have never experienced that with a server while having a big group before, so thank you so much Emilia, you rock. Don't change! ~~

Came for happy hour and wound up sitting outside, by myself for a while.  First off, why do they not have misters outside? Everyone who came out later due to the bar area being full was complaining about the heat and the misters would have helped.  I didn't see any heaters either but maybe they plan to set up portable ones in the winter?  

While it took a bit to get a waiter out to me I was kind of expecting it since I was the only one there.  He brought me a bottle of water and recommended a few beers to taste which I took him up on (being able to taste the beers before you commit to a pint is really great).  He came back fairly quickly again to let me know that he put in the tastes and to take my food order.  The food came at a good pace (tacos first then broccolini) but I waited, and waited for the beer tastes and my cocktail.  He did come out to let me know the bar was backed up and I finally got my beer to taste and picked one (still didn't have the cocktail).  My beer and cocktail finally came out after newer people's drinks so my server said he was taking the drinks off the bill which I appreciated.

However, I let him know I was ready for my bill and then waited, and waited, and waited again until another server who had come out to serve the filling outside area got me my bill.  So the missing two stars are for the slow service.

The food was good and I will be back again to give it another go.  But a tip for others: Friday happy hour is very popular so get there early!

Food is delicious and locally sourced and the beer selection is pretty decent too! My friend was on a diet and asked for just chicken and shredded romaine lettuce, no dressing... no anything but they charged her $16, which seemed ridiculously steep. If the pricing was more appropriate, I would have given this place 5 stars.

Service was great. Sat at the bar and bartenders were super attentive and great with suggestions.  Even overheard that one of the people helping was the manager which I think is always great!  They offered us samples when we didn't even ask and they're suggestions were pretty spot on. Great spot!

I just want to say Thank You for making our birthday celebration so awesome! We were serve by Emily B. She made excellent suggestions to the group based on their food likes and preferences, and everyone loved their meals. What made the evening even better, was the excellent service and the special dishes made and by Chef Jason. Thanks again! Look forward tonier next visit!
They can't update the tap list online! The food combinations make you think the cook is like Dr. Frankinstein! Get back to the basics the "unique" flavor combinations are horrible!

Menu looks good, will be back for food. Pretty nice beer selection, we definitely enjoyed several. Server Michael did a great job describing and recommending based on our taste preferences, not easy as we're a pretty eclectic group. Happiness all around.

I've been wanting to try this restaurant so I was happy when I was invited to Sunday brunch with a group of friends. When I first entered the restaurant it was a bit awkward. I stood at the hostess stand for about 30-45 seconds while three employees walked past but none of them acknowledged me. Luckily, my party wasn't seated too far away so I was able to spot them from the door. There were six of us and the server was great. Also, the seating was comfortable. I ordered the chicken waffles. I'm weird and don't like eggs so I passed on the fried egg that that the dish is served with. The chicken was good but the waffle was pretty dry. I wouldn't order it again. The almost bottomless drinks are a good deal - 4 for $10. I had mimosas and they were tasty.

I was excited about coming here from the good things I heard from friends. I would definitely say I'm disappointed by the taste of the food. Their deserts had odd flavored. One was a (hard/stale) chocolate chip cookie sandwhich with bacon bits wrapped all around the ice cream. I also ordered the fudge brownie which was very dense and dry. The ice cream it was topped with had cayenne pepper sprinkled all on top!! I accidentally took a small amount to see if it was cinnamon or nutmeg possibly (considering they put bacon on ice cream), but nope, it was cayenne pepper. I wish I would've been warned by the waiter or if it would be written on the menu. It killed the taste of the whole thing. The layout was nice but it's extremely loud inside.
The new hot spot in Downtown Summerlin!  Awesome look. Huge layout. Sweet outside wrap around patio. Good food. Try the PBJ sliders. Very unique twist!  Tasted great.

Love public school! I've been here over a handful of times for brunch and happy hour. They have a great selection for beer and food has always been good. My favorite is the buffalo cauliflower and veggie skillet for brunch. :) we usually sit at the bar and Ryan is always our server! She is great, sweet and very attentive! We have sat in the restaurant area  and I have to say the service has been a bit slow(just being honest) Sitting at the bar is our go to if we are lucky to get seats!
Hidden place, no host, food quality is dry and no flavor. Do not recommend as a "restaurant" maybe ok on the bar side but need upbeat bartenders. Sad to say this but this place won't last long

Public-school was a fun restaurant infusing culinary accomplishment with foods found in a public school cafeteria. I was pleasantly surprised with the delicious meal. Generally with strongly themed restaurants the decore overshadows the taste, But with public-school both were surprisingly well done. We started with the artisan meats and cheeses and bacon tater tots. The tater tots were simply amazing. Obviously hand crafted in-house, the fried combination of hashed potatoes, cheese and bacon was pleasing, but the pairing with sriracha-ketchup was perfect. The meats and cheeses were just ok. The only wow on the platter was the goat cheese with marmalade. For the main course, I had the chicken and waffles with bacon red-eye gravy, syrup and hot sauce. I was highly impressed with the cornmeal waffles and the sauces used to bring the course together. The combination of sweet, salty and spivey from the sauces cut through to traditional home style dish. I loved the meal despite the chicken being ordinary and under spiced. All-in-all, a great meal for the slightly inflated price.

Haley the waitress is awesome!!
Bartenders are really slow, but she made up for it with her stellar customer service.

A group of new friends joined my boyfriend and I for some drinks and we ended up staying the entire happy hour. Great drinks, awesome happy hour prices on food and bevs and a fun menu.

Cauliflower buffalo bites are phenomenal and the hummus was mouth watering. I'll be back tomorrow  !!

I had the Huntsman burger with bacon and was very impressed. Super flavorful and very tasty. Fries were above average as well. They don't offer/carry ranch dressing which is odd...every school in America serves ranch. They were very accommodating with subbing out items for my wife who has special food needs as well. I'll definitely be back.

Amazing food, terrible service. This was our first time here and we were so excited to try. The hostess was extremely rude to start when I told her we had a party of 8. We had no expectation of being seated right away so I'm not sure where her attitude came from. Once we were seated we ordered some appetizers, waters, and drinks. There were four times where all 8 of us had empty glasses of water and had to ask someone to bring us more. I was never brought a refill on my lemonade (I think the fresh lemonade was missing an ingredient so i was ok dealing with water) without asking multiple times for one. One out of four of our appetizers never came out and we had to track down our waiter to remind him to bring it. The food came out and he never checked on our food (or water). One bison burger was ordered medium well and was completely rare. It was picked at around the edges but barely eaten, but I'm sure it didn't phase the lazy waiter. When it was time for our 4 separate checks he pulled the "our system can't do that" bs and had us literally write down per couple what we had, the price of each item, add it all up, include tax and give him the tab at the end for him to ring up. It took about 20 minutes to write everything out and then the computer magically rang separate checks. 

Now onto the good food: cauliflower buffalo appetizer was my favorite. We also tried the bacon cheese tots, chorizo Mac n cheese, and the calamari, which were all a huge hit. I had the steak with truffle butter and Mac n cheese. It was a good size portion and very tasty! My husband had the bison burger which was pretty good but his was also not cooked properly. The prosciutto pizza was alright but a little difficult to eat because the prosciutto is not cut up into pieces, and the chicken and waffles were great!

Cool place. Not so great if you want good service, sat at the bar area ordered a beer and two glasses of wine. It took a little over 15 minutes for the drinks, and then the waitress couldn't remember who got what. Place wasn't horribly busy either. Sad, seems like this place could be a lot of fun but not sure we'll be back.

We came in for brunch and got sat outside. Waited about 5 minutes to get waters and spent another 10 minutes waiting for someone to take our order for drinks. After finally getting tired of waiting we went to the bar and ordered drinks. I would have given them 1 star but what saved them was the bartenders which were all nice and their 10 dollar bottomless mimosas for brunch. Other than the bartenders and specials everything else was bad. I'll try this place again in a few weeks. Hopefully it's better.

Food was excellent. We had the fried chicken and waffles. The bison burger and the adobo tacos. Would order all three again. We finished off with lemon dessert. So good. Service was prompt without being overbearing. Comfortable atmosphere without being stuffy. Would consider bringing my kids next time around. Will be back.

Came for their Dogfish event. Was pleasantly surprised by all the varieties of craft beer they had, being a craft beer enthusiast I must say they have one of the best selections in town. Caught the tail end of happy hour and the food was AMAZING! Will definitely be back in.

I agree with a few others reviews in that IT'S LOUD! They seriously need noise dampers. It's also very BJ's, YardHouse, Cheesecake Factory-ish style menu. But I feel like the food here is pretty good. Service sucks but that's just Vegas-esque. Nice happy hour menu, beer menu changes weekly... overall I'm a fan. I've been multiple times. Wish they had more TVs tho. Patio in the spring/fall will be a good time.

The food was delicious especially the Tater tots and Chorizo Mac n Cheese. I have seen the Knocks on service and I can honestly say our sever was Tyler and he was very attentive and knows the menu very well.. We will be back!!!!

Vanessa was incredible, the drinks were amazing, and the food was great. Get the flat iron steak and mac n' cheese. 
Cancel the four roses and replaced with Woodford in the lavender cocktail. 
Thanks Vanessa!
A great place to hangout and grab a bite to eat and drink!  The food and beer selections are very good.  The service and ambiance is A1!  My wife and I now have a favorite place to hangout.

Just checked out this new Downtown Summerlin spot.  I would highly recommend it!  It had a very cool vibe, the service was very friendly, and the food was excellent!

Pros: Food was great!  Service was friendly, outside area was very nice

Cons:  Inside was VERY loud, they were out of a few beers on tap, 

Overall, very well done, definately a place I would go back to!

Went here in a party of 4 this Saturday night. The place has very cool decor that sticks with the school theme. The menus were cool how they looked like composition books. We sat in the communal dining area because there was a 45 minute wait for the private tables and the bar was full. Our waitress was very friendly however we were waiting on our drinks forever. I ordered a steak salad and our friends had a burger. The atmosphere was social but the music and the loudness of everyone's conversation was definitely clashing. Our friend's got their food about 5 minutes before us... I thought this was very unprofessional as we were telling our friends to go ahead and start eating and they felt awkward eating in front of us. We had ordered medium-well for both the burger and the steak salad and when we got our food, both cuts of meat were very pink. I almost sent my steak salad back but I knew it would take even longer to get it and we had already been waiting a while. The salad lacked flavor and I ended up asking for lemons and vinegar to season it myself. I would still go again here but I would choose something else on the menu and order well-done to avoid having an almost still mooing cow delivered on my plate.

Another great place for food. Enjoyed the setting - place looked good, and it was casual enough that I wasn't intimidated at all. The staff was also friendly and efficient. 
We got there while they were serving brunch on Saturday afternoon around 1PM, so I got to splurge on their Beermosa. Pretty yummy for my first beer cocktail. What else did we get... Umm...
Appetizers: Speck & Eggs and Chorizo Mac & Cheese. I, myself, definitely liked both. The boyfriend also had to admit that this was one of the best deviled eggs he's had for the hint of spice they add for flavor. 
Entree: House Pepperoni Pizza for the boyfriend, and a Crispy Chicken Sandwich for me. LOL. Boyfriend enjoyed the pizza, but he was peeved that I told him we'd be having spaghetti for dinner with my family... "I'm having Italian twice today?!" XD My sandwich was awesome! Chicken was cooked very well, and I appreciated the crunchy exterior for texture, plus it looked good. Real good... Also enjoyed their version of aioli sauce to the last drop. Oh! I also have to add that the ketchup has a small kick to it. I seriously thought my taste buds were outta whack until I had my boyfriend confirm it wasn't just me drinking too much. 
The cool part was the Banana Bread Pudding. Hehehe... Dessert ended the meal on a really good note. You have to ask your server about their dessert menu though 'cause it's verbally described to you.
Not including tip for everything we had, it came out to be around $63. Worth it...!
LOL. Now I know why my sister and brother-in-law keep coming out here without me.

Located in The new shopping district of Summerlin...Public School 702 makes it's home in Downtown Summerlin. A very modern and hip restaurant at that, themed after school/education like atmosphere. Everything from their menus to decorations sets the place off right. This huge place located on the second floor also has an outdoor balcony area that almost rivals the inside seating of course depending on weather. This casual yet up beat restaurant provides quick and friendly service by their staff who are also dressed casual. Not quite sure, we came on a weekend and noticed a weekend menu...so there might be a separate weekday one as well. They also have happy hour which they call recess which plays to the theme.
