Chorizo pieces were too hard for my liking but the hubs said that's how it's supposed to be, that real chorizo.  Loved how it was topped with salt and vinegar potato chips. That way yummy. I kept going back for more! I had the short ribs which was very tender just not enough flavor for me. I needed salt. Nutella cookie was good but I prefer soft gooey cookies, this one was a little hard. My husband said you could ask them to warm it up. 

Next visit I do want to try the shrimp pasta, bison burger and lemon dessert :)

I did also find it strange that reservations over 6 need manager approval. I never got a callback to confirm. Luckily plans changed and it was just a party of four so I was able to reserve on line.  Service was good once we got there. Waitress was nice and helpful and apologetic when dessert took some time. Overall cool new spot, just have to find some favorite dishes.

This place was super fun we are thinking about making it an every Sunday funday spot. We had a large group and were well taken care of by our waitress BRITTANY, she did a great job and was super friendly. The brunch menus had some great options as did the drink menus

Pretty cool spot, a bit yuppy-ish for me sometimes.

Great spot for first dates, as I've taken a couple ladies there.
Never had a bad time.

The staff are friendly and younger.
Plenty of tattoos and piercings to go around.

Food is innovative and fun to eat.
Beer selection is outstanding for such a pub.

Very comfortable and inviting. Service was amazing(ask for Matt he was the best!) and the food is great! We went on Saturday afternoon so it wasn't as busy which made for a great first impression. We are going back for happy hour next time.

We came here on a Sunday evening for dinner. We were seated right away on their awesome patio. There is a great selection of beers and I love the 'school' theme! The food was amazing and they have a lot of interesting options. We got the bison burger with quinoa salad, bangers and mash and the ice cream sandwich with bacon for dessert. Our waiter, Zo, was especially helpful and offered a lot of advice on what we would like. He definitely sold us on the dessert and it was well worth it. We can't wait to come back!!

Ask for Selina! She gave us excellent service. Our mimosas were always cold and full! She attended right away to any request. Had a fabulous brunch in the sunny weather. They have both heaters and fans at the outdoor tables. The food was quality. We had the breakfast burrito and chicken sandwich with tater tots as a starter. Freshly made and delicious!

Server Peter was attentive and remembered all our orders without writing them down. Enjoyed the food and atmosphere. Al fresco dining is great during spring and fall. Also recommend the bottomless Mimosas for brunch.

Made reservations which was needed on a Saturday.  Very funky old schools atmosphere with text books- the menu look like composition notebooks.   Everything was good..the Cheese and bacon Tator tots were just ok and husband's lamb burger was suppose to be medium rare and was medium well...but he doesn't send food back so his issue.   Scrimp and Grits were interesting--- the Grits were more of a Palenta cake not grits- fresh corn was perfect!    Best item on the menu was The Cutting Board with Chef selected meats and artisian cheeses with the most delicious fig jam!

For a place that advertises itself as educating you on beer, their selection was small and unimpressive. The list we received wasn't accurate, either, with a beer on it that as far as I can tell doesn't exist. They were "out of it." Yeah...

The food is eclectic, so it's hard to dig through their menu. It would be nice if there were few simpler items on the menu for just enjoying some food while drinking your beer. I had to look things up on Google to figure out what they were in some cases. That said, the bison burger wasn't bad, but way too expensive for what little of a patty you get. I've had them before that were much bigger and cheaper.

The waitress was great at first, but then she disappeared until we were done. I don't remember her coming back once during the meal itself.
Lunch was amazing.  Excellent choice of options, perfect portions, great draft beers with rotational selections, highly recommended this place!
Great food and great service highly recommended. Go there for brunch and try the French toast you won't be disappointed

I LOVE this place. The crushed velvet cocktail is absolutely delicious. The theme is adorable here with the menus being composition notebooks and take out bags saying "homework" on them. I have already eaten here twice in the last couple weeks. Love love LOVE this place.

I really enjoyed this place! They have so many options even for my wife who is vegetarian. The buffalo cauliflower is amazing is a favorite and the craft cocktails are well thought out. 

The reason they are receiving 5 stars. The staff is so friendly and energetic. Our server was quick to notice what I needed before I knew I needed it, for instance the buffalo sauce for the awesome cauliflower. Management stopped by and checked up on us. They really know what they are doing here!

The food was very good. Overpriced though. The service was horrible! We were ignored for the first 10 minutes when we sat down. Our waitress never smiled once... It looked like all of the waiters were zombies with no emotion and not friendly at all! I hope management reads these reviews and can take note that your waiting staff sucks!!

I really liked this place - I went in on one of the very first days. I enjoyed the unique food combinations and we tried a lot! The service was very friendly and accommodating. 

My favorite thing about them is the very large patio. They have spots for beer pong, oversized Jenga, oversized Connect Four. I like where it's located also. Hopefully they do well! Attached is a photo of the beer pong area.

Brunch options are great. Relaxed atmosphere on the sunny terrace. Chicken sausage, eggs on grits was very tasty. OJ was fresh squeezed.
 Server not too attentive though.

Disgusting! Read all these great reviews, was so excited to try it, as we approached the door there was a girl smoking RIGHT in front of the door and proceeded to flick her cigarette butt right in front of the door while making eye contact, she knew it was not the place. This was tile ground, not some dirty park. Bad first impression. The first 2 tables we tried to sit at were covered in leftover food. It was a slow night so if a restaurant doesn't know serving 101, clean your tables after the guests leave there was no way we trusted the rest of the cleanliness. We sat for 5 mins and still no one cared to wipe/sanitize the tables. The back of the house must be filthy if that is the standard of the front of the house. Again, slow night, employees just standing around. We walked out. Downtown Summerlin has a lot of restaurant options that I'm sure sanitize and clean up after their guests.
Jess and "Thor" were awesome servers.  The food was very good.  Interesting cauliflower appetizer in a good way.  We were too full for dessert but they sounded delish.

Came here a couple days ago. I know you guys are waiting for my review. 
This place isn't tooo shabby, it's a nice hipster type of place. But, the food was just mediocre to say the least. I'm not gonna hop on the hype train like everyone else, I'm going to give you guys the real review. Food was just ehh, you know how you tell your neighbors to keep it down. You're just like "keep it down"
I'm like "the food is ehhhhhh"
You know what I mean, rather go Bjs, lazy dog, or anywhere in dts!
Great atmosphere and vibe! Good was ok nothing spectacular and it did takes us 30 minutes to get a drink...that we had ordered from two different waiters... They still need to work some crinks out

Really great vibe... And waitress Brittany helped with that a ton..... Although we did not take her suggestions... We ordered amazing food.... The fried cauliflower was to-die-for.... Ask for the ginger aioli with it.... The bomb!!! (That was Brittany's suggestion) working on the Nutella sandwich for dessert... So I must go now.... Wish me luck!!!

Love the ambiance super cute. Doubt we will be back prices are super high for a hamburger $17 is crazy. Maybe if service was up to par it wouldn't have bothered me so much.  Food is good but overpriced.

Our dining adventure continues through Downtown Summerlin. Public school 702 offers Brunch on weekends along with the regular menu. The restaurant is a large space with an enormous outdoor patio. Indoors the room has high ceilings and hard surfaces but was conversation friendly. 
At check in we requested a booth and only waited a few minutes for one to be cleared. Service was prompt with our server offering water while we perused the menu.. Refreshments include bottomless Bloody Mary's and Mimosas. If you drink more than two it becomes a money saver. Review the large chalk board at the entrance if you are beer lover.

We chose the Ahi tuna Tacos as a starter. There are four to an order with avocado salsa, and lemon aioli served in crispy wonton shells. The Ahi Tuna was fresh and flavorful. The shells provided a nice crunch.
Chicken Sausage & Cheddar Grits are on the Brunch menu and come with two fried eggs, blistered tomatoes, grilled corn, bacon, greens and a beer sauce. The chicken sausage has a little heat and the entire dish is a nice mix that will fill you up. 
Grilled Salmon with Summer Succotash is on the regular menu. Our server did not ask the degree of doneness for the salmon, however it was prepared to my satisfaction, cooked all the way through with nice grill marks. The salmon is served with roasted  vegetables, edamame, corn, squash and citrus butter.
Public School 702 has a Happy Hour in the bar and extends to part of the patio. Since the patio faces east I would recommend it for when the sun move across the roof and adds some shade. Ceiling fans help with the circulation. The beer menu has a wide variety of choices. 
A return visit is a must to further explore the offerings.

Excellent food but if you're coming here for bottomless mimosas go to Whist over in Green Valley. We were here for three hours and got 2 mimosas. Slow service and they pre make them so they are flat. Horrible, hands down the worst bottomless mimosa brunch in Vegas.

Ordered the Buffalo Cauliflower, Brocollini and Fish and Chips. The Buffalo Cauliflower was amazing! Brocollini was different. Long strands of broccoli with Parmesan grated over it. Lastly the fish and chips. The fish was very bland. There was no taste to it. It came with tartar sauce and guacamole. However, the presentation on the food was amazing. This is a fun place to go with friends for lunch dates!

The atmosphere is cute, but the chairs are definitely not comfy. The food has that weird fusion vibe, but the Mac & Cheese was delicious so well worth it! We also added Jungle Juice to our dinner and that was yummy too!
Great food. The wait can get long. So suggest going on weird times. Ordered the pizza twice. One to take home. Vanessa is great!!!!

Came here for the first time in over a year. I remember it being better... I ordered the Moody Burger and it was NOT good at all. 
The horseradish aioli is way too overpowering and instantly gives you bad breath, I had to take my bun off just to eat the burger. My burger tasted like charcoal too. The fries were yummy though. 
My boyfriend ordered the Eggs Benedict pizza. SALTYYYY so much salt, it needed like tomatoes or avocado or something to dull out the salt. 
The beer selection was decent. Sad they got rid of the Dawn of the Red beer. 
It wasn't very good, I may try it again someday but odds are I won't. 
Service was slow but the servers were nice...
This place is too expensive for what you're getting. I wouldn't recommend it

We have been back several more times and each time it only gets better! The food, the service, everything! We decided to try their brunch today and it was awesome! Derrick was our server and he was great. We knew from the moment that he introduced himself that we were in good hands. The chicken sausage grits were great!! We will definitely be back!

First time here, thought the decor and theme was very fun. The atmosphere was great too. We all enjoyed our food very much, very flavorful and lots to choose from. 

HOWEVER... service----- SLOW SLOW SLOWWWWWW!!! Hence, the 3 star review. What's the deal!!??!! The waiter was nice but very forgetful. Drinks seemed to take a very long time. The drinks were in my opinion overpriced.. this isn't the strip, it's freakin Summerlin.. why do we have to price gouge the locals? My Jack Daniels and water was somewhere around $20. Come on! 

My grilled salmon was absolutely delicious. It was $21 but it was worth it. My friends enjoyed the deviled egg appetizers and tater tots. Again, food was very good but service, they need to improve. Couldn't tell if it was the waiter, the kitchen, the bar or all of the above that made everything seem so slow. Not sure that I will come back anytime soon.
The food, service and atmosphere was awesome! I loved the school theme and had a great vibe. I would recommend it!!

What can I say about PS702? We always have a great time here! From the food to the drinks to the service.... It's always on point! I especially love brunch... What's not to like about an eggs Benedict pizza or stuffed French toast? And they always have the best selection of craft beers! Every time I'm there, there is something new to taste! And most times I'm educated (see what I did there? Lol) on a new beer I haven't even heard of. Also a fun night out with the live music! Last time I was in, one of the performers was from the Voice!!!! Do yourself a favor and check it out!!!! It won't disappoint!

Went with friends to celebrate my wife's birthday and had a not so great experience. Service was ok but the food was not hot. From appetizers to the entries everything was room temperature to warm, like the food was made and sat around. Some of the dishes severely lacked basic seasoning in the form of salt and pepper, and chicken in the salad tasted like it was cooked(overcooked) the day before, then shredded for use the next day. Kids chicken finger was fried for longer than needed. We were seated near the kitchen and I could tell that there was no one in control of the food coming out of the kitchen, very undisciplined. Been there before and the food was much better months ago before the started changing some of the plating of the food. No complaints on the bar side or service side. They did recognize some of the faults of the kitchen and took it off our bill and gave us a dessert to share

No bang for your buck here. The happy hour "recess time" is decent. We reviewed the lunch and dinner menu while we waited for our food. Not much price difference from happy hour! Like $1 difference. And this is just bar food. We got the crushed velvet. Their version of a Moscow mule with blueberry and blackberry flavor. We got the Parmesan truffle frites, speck & eggs, crispy naked wings, and crispy ahi tuna tacos. The one thing that was worth it we're the truffle fries and ahi tuna tacos. The food is decent. You can tell that they are trying to bring different flavor and style to their menu. The wings tasted like fried chicken and side note - they don't have ranch. It was worth a try, but honestly, I would not be back.
Love this place! It's so cute inside with their school theme.  Always have different beers and and I love their menu. A little eclectic but everything I've had was great!

My favorite restaurant in Downtown Summerlin, the Wild Mushroom pizza is sooooo good, Moody burger was a great one too. Outside seating is nice during fall - winter, I wish the restaurant was taller, but the view is still nice. Good for kids as well!

Went here for drinks & the drinks were all very good! We got a few different beers (I personally recommend the "not your fathers root beer"...so good!). I also order a guavalajara cocktail & it was very good as well! It had a strong guava flavor, but not too overpowering. It almost tasted like a guava margarita! 
I'm giving 4 stars because of the service...it was slow...really slow! We didn't necessarily mind because we were talking and enjoying ourselves, but we did have a lag between drinks & water refills..
Chris totally hooked us up for brunch...phenomenal service! Brunch menu is great and who can go wrong with bottomless mimosas!

Was invited at last minute to a wine event, rock n roll wine hosting. The appearance is very chic and modern reminding me of something on the East Coast where I'm from. Just ordered the crispy buffalo cauliflower, hold on...Holy Moley! Thanks Bree for the heads up. Its delicious and I can taste why its voted a best here in Vegas. I put that ish on everythang! Will be back

Not very impressed with 702. Layout is off. And bar area small. It was just eh ok along with the food and drink selections. Wait over 8 minutes for our drinks and the wait staff seemed like they didn't want to be there either. I think this is a one and done.

The food offerings at Public School 702 are fine, it's the service I can't get past. I've been there with my wife three or four times now and service has always been terrible. There was one occurrence where our appetizer came out super quick, but the waiter realized it was for the wrong table and took it back... didn't get ours for another 20-30 minutes. 

The bar is always packed and the energy is awesome, but the restaurant isn't, which means to me they aren't bringing in enough servers to accommodate the group. For such a cool idea, I hope they amp up the service because I want to love it. I'll likely be back as well.
You have Wolf Gang Puck but this place is busier.  I don't get it. Marginal at best.   This place is not good.  It's ok but the chicken and waffles is ugly.
Food was amazing!! Our waitress  Jess was the best!!! Super sweet and helpful! Great experience
This place was awesome.  Really loved the atmosphere its very fun and the food amazing. Bison burger, lamb burger. And adobo tacos.    And desert was amazing

Loved the atmosphere and choices of beers. This place reminded me of restaurants in San Diego! Service was really good and their cocktails were very yummy. Passion fruit mojito tastes really refreshing. And I forgot the name but the coffee  cocktail they have was good and strong. The food however, was mehhhh. The ahi poke was decent with the passion fruit sauce in there but the fish didn't taste fresh. Now on to the entree. I got fish and chips and wow, the inside was less barely warm and there was wayyyy too much batter. I ended up just eating the fish on the inside and left out the batter. Fries could be crispier. They were too soggy in my opinion. Definitely ask for the bbq honey sauce to dip your fries in. All in all, I would come back here just for drinks and maybe some bar food during happy hour. I don't think their entrees are worth the $$$.

Public School has my attention. We had the Parmesan Truffle Fries, Margherita Pizza, PB&J Sliders, & the Chorizo Mac n Cheese. 

Walking in it was louder than we expected it to be. Classic cafeteria chatter echoing throughout. They didn't do the best job explaining how/where to sit, but our wandering caught the eye of someone who ended up being helpful. It's a "Make Friends" atmosphere which grew on us. 

The pizza was our least favorite & luckily it was also last. Not quite sure if it's simply because it paled in comparison to everything ahead of it. PB&J sliders are a must! That habanero jam MAKES it! Chorizo Mac n Cheese was good the vinegar crunch was the best touch. The texture of the chorizo set it off a bit... tough & chewy. Not sure if that was just ours or how it is, but good enough to go back and try again!

We also had the Dawn of the Red by Ninkasi Brewing Co - slight hints of pineapple, mango, and papaya. An adventure for your taste buds!

I was on assignment so I had to check out Happy Hour Items only but I was eyeing a watermelon dish that I will update w/ name later.

Overall good time, good taste. Atmosphere gives you something to automatically talk about a

LOVE this place after 2 brunch visits. I wonder if their dinner is bad since, honestly, brunch is SO GOOD here. 

Ambiance: 5/5 casual, trendy, with a fun, public school theme. space is large, which is nice since they were able to easily accommodate our huge (10ppl) group on short notice. 

Service: 4/5 friendly, but can get a bit slow at times.

Food: 
-Chorizo Mac & Cheese: 5/5 SO GOOD. Creamy, savory, yummy, goodness. Scrape the bottom of the plate goodness. Also excellent value. I'd just get this as  meal.
-Bacon Tater Tots: 5/5 Also very yummy. crispy on the out side buttery flaky on the inside. SO GOOD.
-Speck & Eggs: 3/5 Good but not out of the ordinary.
-Fried Jidori Chicken and Green Chili Cornbread Waffles: 5/5 Delicious chicken, perfectly seasoned, crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside. Waffle was maybe not the typical texture but you have to remember it's cornbread. Still very good. Also, HUGE portion.
-Stuffed French Toast: 5/5 Very good. Sweet but not overly sweet.
-Shrimp and Grits: 5/5 Perhaps the best shrimp and grits I've ever had. the grits didn't come in a bowl of mush, but rather in something like a grit cake--a little crunch on the outside and creamy on the inside. 
-Almost bottomless Mimosa: 2/5 it's fine but mimosa is a mimosa. Nothing special. and definitely loses out to the bloody mary.
-Almost bottomless bloody mary: 10/5 OMG. it came with a pickled garlic and a...chicken wing. NO JOKE. Solid spicy kick, and not too sweet. I swear next time I'm just coming to get bottomless bloody mary. That's 4 bloody marys and 4 chicken wings. for $10. What more can you ask for in a brunch? Amazeballs.

Fantastic food and our server Tyler was awesome! This was our first time visiting this Resturant and it was incredible! The appetizers were delicious and the steak was so good! Give it a try and I hope you are lucky enough to be seated in Tyler's section but I am sure they are all fantastic, but Tyler was outstanding!

Over all a pretty good spot.  The outdoor patio and overall vibe is really good. Food was excellent and unique.  I recommend the buffalo cauliflower. My wife had the crushed velvet drink and loved it.  The reason I only gave them 3 stars was due to the beer. They have a good selection but ran out of two of their Wheat beers.  I tried 3 others. They were all very hop heavy in taste.  The first one was a witber, which should be smooth but had a strong after taste. I drank about half and told the server it was very hoppy and asked if they had anything smoother.  He brought me another brand. Not as hoppy but still had a stronger taste.  Not comparable to the brand I described to him. I was able to finish it. I tried one more brand but still had a strong finish.  My guess is the brands they were out of were the ones that were less harsh.  The server didn't seem very knowledgable about the brands that they serve. If you like IPA's this is your place.  If you like beer like Smithwicks, Newcastle, Leinenkugel, Stella and smoother domestics, I would not recommend going here for a beer.  Great vibe though. We will go back if friends pick the place. Don't see us choosing this as our DTS spot.

Disappointing. We waited for 702 to open for a very long time after trying the public school in California first and absolutely falling inlove with it. Let me start this review by saying we really tried to love this place. We have gone at least 10 times ( all for the love of craft beer).

PROS: Atmosphere is very cool. And of course the #1 reason anyone should go there is for the rotating tap. The managers have tried to make our experiences a little better by sending out a few comped meals, very much appreciated but tasteless.

CONS: Food is nothing special. We have had everything on the happy hour menu +. The only thing worth eating our the chicken sausage, which they have been out of the last 3 times I tried to give this place another attempt. You get a very small portion of chicken sausage for too high of a price for happy hour. And they are only available on happy hour boo (thumbs down) Everything else on the menu is really really uneventful. 
Bartenders are not very knowledgeable about the beer which is just plain saddening. 

Let me share our brunch experience. The mimosas are a joke. If u want good bottomless mimosas I suggest Echo and Rig and DW Bistro. The mimosas at 702 come premixed for u, which is ridiculous I'm an adult and will choose how much champagne I would like in my mimosa thank you. When asked if we could have our OJ on the side the answer was no. When we went to order our waitress told us those particular items would not be ready to order for a 45 mins.. um excuse me? So we waited and 45 mins to put in on order and another 40 to get our food, which of course was tasteless. Brunch was a complete joke and the waitress wasn't anything special either. 

If we return it will be for beer only. That's all they got going for them. So sad.

The food here is absolutely amazing. We had my birthday planned for a different place, but immediately switched to Public School after eating here once. The food is out of this world, and the beer selection is amazing. I recommend the jidori chicken with jalapeno cornbread waffles. Make sure to ask for Vanessa as your server. She walked me through the extensive beer menu and even provided me with samples of her recommendations. Best service ive had ina  long time.

Can't say enough good things about Public School 702. This is my third time here and everything has been great. 

Fried chicken and waffles with the green chile cornbread waffles are so good. Ahi tuna taco app was also really, really good. 

Brittany is a very attentive waitress and lots of fun. She is smart and very knowledgable about the menu. Trust her advice. This is one of the best places in Vegas.

The service was good.. The food okay.. I can not eat a lot of garlic and the food is all in garlic.. I ordered the Grits & Egg and was unable to eat the item..
Wow..
I am impressed the GM called about my experience, because of his professionalism and his concern..this shows that he cares..I will try 702 again .. I will Update my review..

Had this place bookmarked and was excited to try it out with my sweetheart. We went right at the top of happy hour and sat at the bar. It was a Wednesday and we were easily able to choose our seats. By the time we left, I was glad we came early, because the bar and the restaurant were really filling up. Ladies, there's hooks to hang your purses at the bar. I swear bars always get points from me for this! 

I had the Mule kick for my cocktail...tasty but heavy on the ginger. For our food we ordered only from the happy hour menu which they call, Recess. 
The deviled eggs were sharp in their taste and yummy.  I will get those again. I'm not usually one for the tastes of fried food but the fried cauliflower was awesome. It was light and tasty-I'd get these again as well. We also got the hummus with quinoa; the flavor was on the light side with a healthier feel. I'd get these again. 

My favorite, which came by a complete surprise because I'm not the biggest fan of peanut butter, were the PB&j sidekicks. These mini burgers with a touch of peanut butter were so delightful that I'm having to rethink peanut butter again

I have not actually gotten to eat at this restaurant because all 3 time I have gone they chose to close before their posted closing time. They didn't seem to care about my business anytime I went in and just said they didn't have enough business to stay open. I will not be returning for this reason.

The service was extremely slow. It took 10 minutes to greet you when you say down. It took 45 minutes for the arrival of our meal. The food was not high quality.  I was told by my waiter that the steak salad had romaine lettuce, radish, balsamic vinaigrette. What came out was arugula, radish, and not so tasty vinaigrette. I was not impressed with the food or service.
Accommodating to my special diet request, but service was very slow, felt over priced for a salad... But flavor profiles were good. Expected more.
Great place for a group or just two. Menu has something for everyone. Nice servers good food and atmosphere. Fun for any occasion!

A mixed bag. The tomato and watermelon salad was amazing as was the fried chicken and waffles. No issues with the food at all. The service was wonky. It was early, 5:00 on a Tuesday, and they couldn't seem to figure out who was supposed to be waiting on us. We plan on giving it another shot because the food was great. Beautiful space too, and fortunately it was mostly empty when we were there because I bet it gets crazy loud when it's full.
Great craft beer selection, had a great quinoa salad (no, I'm not a hipster), and their buffalo cauliflower was great.  I'd go again just for the beer.
A great place to hang out, delicious apps and entrees, fun ambiance, and their watermelon mojitos are amazingly good!

Great spot for brunch. They can Handel a crowd, trust me we had a table of 9 and they were able to handle us easily with no wait. The waitresses were super nice and very informative about the menu and the best way to utilize the Bottomless drinks 
Had a great time can't wait until next weekend

Came here for lunch and had the salmon ... Actually attempting to eat it now as I am writing this review. The food taste horrible portion size is enough to feed a small 5 year old child - they are incredibly small. Their lunch menu consists of 30 items none of which are appetizing. Additionally, I requested a straw so i wouldn't have to put my lips on the glass for water and I was brought out a cocktail stir stick not a straw. I would AVOID this place like the plague if deciding to come her for lunch, perhaps dinner is better but I won't be coming back to find out. I will be letting family and friends know of the disappointment this place is, and that they should avoid it. Go eat at California Pizza kitchen or even Wolf gang Puck instead (slightly better portion size and better food). Disappointed in leaving this place still hungry ... My girlfriend ordered the fish and chips and didn't even finish her meal she stated she wasn't the slightest impressed with the food or service.
Ok drinks are excellent food is not a do over.  Service is below the norm. I like the concept however too many other great restaurants in the downtown summerlin area.

I have tried this restuarant now 4 times and each time it loses a star but tonight was my final visit..
1)The inside is so loud it is hard to carry on a conversation so we love to sit outside, but tonight they had a very loud DJ which made the inside seem quiet.  They also kept sounding off a loud horn which was quite annoying.  The ambiance does not reflect the restuarants name; Public School, it seems more like a loud bar with a sub par disconnected menu.
2) We ordered Salmon with  vegetables and steak salad...The salmon was delicious, but the vegetables tasted like dish soap and the lettuce served with the 4 pieces of thinly sliced steak looked and tasted like day old bag lettuce...a little salt and pepper would have been nice to enhance some flavor, but our server never returned until we were done with our meal.
3) We ordered 3 glasses of wine, 1 califlower appetizer, 1 Steak Salad, and 1 Salmon with vegetables..approximately $95.00.  They did take $11.00 off for the dish soap veggies, but the service was challenging and for paying almost $100.00 it was very disappointing.  It's so unfortunate since it is a great location.

I've heard a lot of great things about Public School 702, and I have to say they did not disappoint. The venue itself has a wonderful theme. There's memorabilia all over the restaurant from generations of different schools. The bar area is reminiscent of a gymnasium with bleachers and a scoreboard. There's also shuffleboard, beer pong, and extremely large Jenga. Right off the bat, I was impressed.

We were greeted promptly by our server, Jared Smith. He gave us a tour of the menu and went over the craft beer list. There are about 40 of them! He recommended the crushed velvet for me, as I'm not much of a beer drinker, and the tenaya brown for my husband, who is. The crushed velvet was delicious! It's like a blackberry Moscow mule. Next we ordered the mezze plate and the crispy cauliflower, based on Jared's recommendations, and both were delicious.

For dinner I ordered the salmon with succotash and my husband had the fried chicken and waffles, also Jared's recommendations. The salmon was fresh and paired delightfully with the succotash. The combination of the crushed velvet and the salmon was so good I had to order another one. My husband raved about his dish so of course I tried it, and yes it was delicious. A bit too many calories for me, but if that's no concern to you (and it's not too my husband), then this is the dish for you!

All in all it was a great experience and the bill was extremely reasonable. The atmosphere is light and fun, and the food and beverage are delightful. I was very impressed with Jared and his recommendations. We loved everything he picked, and he made the experience even more enjoyable. Public school - we will definitely be back!

I visited here twice with my girlfriend. The first time, we had a decent experience and I don't remember having any complaints.

We revisited this place on July 2nd, 2016 at around 7 pm.. We wanted an outside table and were told there was a 15 minute wait and they would text us when the table was ready. They finally texted us around 20 minutes later and we were seated outside. At first, the hostess tried to seat us at the only table with a broken fan when it was over 100 degrees outside! After bringing that to her attention we were seated at a table with a working fan.

We sat at the table for 20 minutes. No one came to take our drink orders. No one asked us if we needed help. One waitress made eye contact with me 3 times and didn't say anything. 

We ended up leaving and going to Wolfgang Puck next door which was excellent by the way.

I would not recommend this place based on the non-existent service.
Kristina very nice bartender makes great cocktails  trendy spot open floor plan creates great open ambience and I love the pizza!

This was one of the best meals I've had in a long time. Was surprised to discover they were open at 11 on a Sunday; turns out they have brunch starting at 10 with bottomless-ish mimosas, micheladas, Bloody Marys, and other choices I already forget. 

He had the smothered burrito and I had the chef's stuffed blackberry lemonade french toast. The burrito was delicious with a perfect blend of flavors and the french toast...you had me at lemon curd. Even the mimosas weren't half-assed, with a splash of blood orange. And the prices were way more than reasonable. We will be back.

Let's start with the positive. The food is quite good and original. Bacon taters tots and mezze plate (hummus, naan, babaganoush) were tasty appetizers. Bison burger was good, though my medium came to me closer to rare. Wife said her steak salad was good. Beer and cocktail menu are very good. 

Service was so-so. We had reservations, but still got seated in one of the worst tables in the house right by the main entrance. Uncomfortable metal chairs, wobbly table. 
Also, our main courses were served 5 minutes after they dropped our appetizers. Hate that. 

Ambience is PS 702's real weakness. This place is cavernous, uninspired in its decor, bizarre in its traffic flow, and ridiculously, jarringly, loud. I mean, can't-hear-the-people-at-your-own-table-loud. Punctuated by unexplained buzzer alarms like you might hear just before the nuclear meltdown.

I'm glad we gave it a try, but doubt I'll be back. Although the food was pretty good, the environment made me feel I was rushing through a meal at a theme park food plaza. Not for everyone, I suppose.

I finally made it over to public school this week after hearing so much about it.   Maybe I went in with my expectations too high but I thought it was just ok.  I thought the beer selection was really nice but my burger was just OK and very pricey.   I think it's cheaper to eat on the strip!   I do like the patio and the vibe so I'll bump it up to 4 stars.

This is the most children friendly restaurant I have been to so far! I highly recommend any family with young children. Super friendly stuff and amazing food. I can't wait for the next time ! 

During my last visit , my daughter who is 3 months old cried non stop. She wouldn't eat and she wouldn't sleep. I tried everything and then my mother started to help and still nothing would work. We went outside at the patio just so we wouldn't interrupt other customers inside the restaurant. Few minutes later, a tall gentleman with a mustache who probably work in the kitchen area came outside with frozen blueberries. He asked us if my daughter is teething and maybe the blue berries will help. 

This is what I call going above and beyond for the customers and take initiatives to exceed customer's expectation ! I didn't get a chance to get his name but 702 instantly became my favorite restaurant!  Great job !

"I really enjoyed the ambiance and the decor played to the theme really well. I usually just drink Miller Lite, but since they only carry craft beer, our server Mandi recommened a cocktail instead and I loved it! It was the crushed velvet, a mule with blackberries! For food we started with the cauliflower app and it was delicious! We also tried the margherita pizza and Caesar salad. Both were good, but do not skip out on the cauliflower!"
Service has definitely declined on visit #2. Food is still awesome!!! Can't wait for service to return to normal....

I've been wanting to check this place out for awhile since it has consistently been getting good reviews. I went with my husband around dinner time on a Friday and we only had to wait 20 minutes which wasn't too bad. 

The first thing you notice when you walk in is how unbelievably loud it is.  It was so loud the hostess was having difficulty communicating where to seat people.  They walked a little ways in, and it started to get quieter, but then we were seated directly under a blaring speaker.  We still managed to get in some dinner conversation, but it did detract from the experience overall.

We ordered the chorizo mac and cheese as an appetizer.  It came practically within a minute of ordering it, which was great for timing, but it also means it was already prepared and waiting for us to order it. I'm not even sure they had to mix it based on how fast it came. The mac and cheese alone was actually pretty boring.  Adding the potato chips gave it a crunch and depth of flavor that helped.  The chorizo was pretty standard, nothing spectacular.  If you managed to get all four things on your fork at the same time it was good, but not great.  

Because the appetizer was out so quickly, we waited about 15 minutes for entrees after the appetizer was finished.  My husband had the steak salad for his entree.  It was supposed to have a white truffle vinaigrette on it.  He assured me that it did lightly taste of truffle, but honestly I couldn't taste it myself.  Perhaps my flavor palette is off.  The salad overall was tasty and had a bunch of different things mixed in.  We ordered the steak med-rare and it came med-well, but it was still delicious.

I ordered the stout braised ribs as my entree and it was fantastic.  The ribs fell apart as soon as you put your fork to them, the gravy was so flavorful, and it was all served on top of yukon gold mashed potatoes.  It was absolutely wonderful.

When the bill came it was over $60 which I think wasn't consistent with the experience I had there.  At those prices, I will head next door to Fogo when it opens for lunch.  I may go back to try out "recess" which is their happy hour, but I will not be returning for dinner.

A nice little gem in Downtown Summerlin.  The atmosphere is great with inside and outside seating.  There are large high tops in the bar area that can sit large parties. 

I had their version of a Moscow Mule (they call it a crushed velvet), fried bacon tots, and shrimp and grits. All of the food was delicious. Our server, Lacy, took good care of us as well.   I highly recommend this place!

So disappointed in the service.  This was our second visit and the service is just awful. I gave it 2 stars because the food is delicious but I will not return due to being ignored for over 30 minutes by our waitress.  We finally got the host to find her so we could get our bill.

I need to give this place another go. I wasn't super impressed by my entre but those cheddar tots with siracha ketchup? OMG... I'd go back just for those. Great location, if the weather is good eat on their patio

Very cool spot, great for dinner or late night drinks/snacks. We got there shortly after 9pm on Saturday night and it was busy! We sat in a booth near the bar and there were outlets and USB outlets on the wall (every restaurant should have this!).

Ordered the crispy buffalo cauliflower, which is possibly the best vegetable I've ever eaten, and the bacon cheddar tots. In an attempt to be healthy, I got a tomato and watermelon stacked salad. It was just okay. My hubby got the steak, which came with chorizo mac and cheese. The mac and cheese was fantastic! Not too cheesy, not too greasy, and still very flavorful. 

I often feel like a 70 year trapped in a nearly 40 year old body, so it was a little noisy for my taste, but if we were there at 6:30 on a Wednesday night instead, I'm sure it would've been a slightly different experience. But overall great food and I'd definitely go back!

Very bad service and the DJ's that they had were a joke .... Blasting music then quiet then blasting.... Then sound checks an hour into the set!! Ha ha ha ha.   Place is empty on the 4th of July..... CPK was packed !! If you want to try it come fast ... This one won't last long !!!

Public school 702 overall dining experience is what I call a great get together place for friends. Their bar is prett cozy. This place is located in downtown summerlin. I tried many varieties of their food and the Poké tacos caught my taste buds. They gave us a complimentary pazookie for their mistake which I highly appreciated. For all you guys trying to have a good social time come to public house 702.

Fantastic happy hour, great light bites such as the mushroom fontina flatbread and the deviled eggs...yes...the eggs! The decor is quirky and unique but just what you'd expect at Public School. Make sure to get there before the "buzzer" to take advantage of their entire happy hour menu!!

Went to the first time to Public School, tried the Outer Darkness and grabbed Chicken sausage pizza and our bartender at the time Coner had suggested the Tart of Darkness and I fell in love. I had an amazong expeirence and looking forward to coming back soon.. Although the music is not what I expected to be in this establishment.

The Staff here is great they are all very helpful and Peter are server was the best our 1st time here and he took the time to go everything with us if you come here I would ask for his section but if he's not all the servers are great

The menu is fresh with a great selection of beers and a rotating list on tap, the food is good and the decor is fun and unique but what stood out the most was the customer service. We had two beers and two appetizers and one beer was a little late and so was one appetizer (30 min late). We didn't complain but when our server realized what had happened she immediately sent the manager over who came to make sure we were having an ok time. And then he comped our entire bill and even asked our server to offer us free dessert. We declined and were impressed at the efforts they made to make the situation right. This is a place you won't be dissatisfied with.

Came here on a Wednesday night and it was surprisingly busy. The wait for a table was about 10 minutes long - once sat the service was extremely slow :/ My waiter only came to my table three times (once to greet, once to take my order, and once after I paid) and when my pitcher of water at my table needed a refill it took a little while to get someone to refill it. 

I ordered the chorizo and shrimp and it was delicious! Not too spicy but still had a light kick. My date got the bangers and mash and it didn't look too good but he liked it so that's all that mattered to me :) 

The atmosphere is very great. It's kind of noisy, hip, modern, chill, etc. Everyone that works here is very friendly, young, and accommodating which I love! But 1 star knocked off because my server didn't come around enough times and I like when my server is alert, aware, and around.

Had a great dinner here last Friday night with family. Tyler was our server and he did a fantastic job. We had a party of 11 with 4 little kids and Tyler handled it well. His recommendation of the Huntsman's burger was spot on. Very tasty. The chorizo Mac and cheese was awesome too. I just wish they had more IPAs on tap.
The bartender Christian Escobar was amazing. He was so intensive and made sure we had everything we needed. Only ask for Christian or you at selling yourself short!!! Thank you Christian

Check out for brunch, you will not be disappointed. You can do 4 drinks mix and match style choosing  mimosa, beermosa, or Bloody Mary, for only $10. And they the drinks are all delicious! Lavender in a beermosa is what your life needs. Trust me. 
The food is also tasty I have had pizza, burgers, vegetable hash, and calamari and it has all been awesome! 
The outdoor seating here is also fabulous, overlooking the walkways of downtown Summerlin where there is often live music. It's hard to beat!

First thing I noticed about this place is how awesome the environment is to the name. The napkins are like school paper, the menus are composition notebooks, and all over the restaurant it feels like an old high school. It's really awesome!

Our server was very friendly and well informed on the menu. She made a lot of good suggestions.

I ordered a pizza. It was good, not great. But overall I liked it. 

It's worth a shot. I think this place deserves at least 4 stars even tho at the time they don't have it. Not sure why. I had a great experience!

This was my 2nd visit. First time was just o.k.; however,  my husband wanted to try it. Second time the same. It is really underwhelming,  especially service.  A bit pricy for small portions. They have a "creative" menu, which I know most my family would not like. Probably won't be back. Too many other much better  restaurants in the area. To compete with the other restaurants,  they really need to step up the service and food.

I really enjoyed my visit there. The food was really different and very enjoyable. I tend to frequent places because of the bar and this place was superb!  There was a bartender by the name of Ryan that really stuck out. She was super friendly and helpful with drink suggestions. I will definitely be back to see her.

I get that Friday nights are busy - no problem.  We were a party of 2, went inside to check the wait, hostess mentioned that it would be a 20-25 minute wait, gave our phone number and waited inside between the rest rooms and hostess stand.  At the 30 minute mark, there were guests that came in after us that were seated.  Hostesses saw that we were still there, never said a thing to us.  40 minutes was our top wait time.  I told the hostess to remove our name, and she asked what our name was and removed it.
Service tip, the front door is the first experience the guests have when you walk into a restaurant.  Acknowledge your guests, keep better track of who has been seated and who hasn't, especially guests that are in front of your face for 40 minutes, advise guests of a longer wait time on a Friday night.  If they get seated earlier, bonus for your team!  If someone removes their name from the wait, have your hostess ask if there was an issue, offer an apology (after watching us wait!), say something!  Growing pains - i'm sure.
We won't be back, nor will we suggest to our friends and family.

This was the worst service I've ever had. My boyfriend and I went in for lunch. There was about a ten minute wait to be seated, which is no big deal. Then we got seated and we waited atleast 10 more minutes until a server that wasn't even in our section, realized no one has even greeted us, or taken out drink order. She took our drink order and then our actual server (the receipt said her name was lauren) showed up a few minutes later to take our drink order and we said someone else took it. She then took our food order I got a ccb with no bun and Brussel and kale slaw. My boyfriend got a chicken and waffles on their Sunday brunch. She leaves to put in our order then returns about 10 minutes later and asks how everything is going and if we were ready to order food. And we just looked at her confused and said that she had already taken our order. She said oh yeah and then stares at my empty iced tea and leaves. I assumed she was getting me more. She then is walking around almost looking like she was trying to be busy but not really doing anything. Our food showed up mine with a bun on it that I asked not to have. I just took it off. Both our meals were delicious. She did not stop back in though to make sure everything was ok. Waited another 15 minutes until we realized she isn't comin back and asked another server for more drinks. Then when we finished our meals she stopped by twice to see if we wanted more drinks. Yeah now that were done eating she wants to be attentive? It was almost humorous how absent she was.

*** someone from public school messaged me on yelp and appologized and asked for my email to further discuss. I gave them my boyfriends email. It's been almost three days now, and they never reached out. Same half ass service as the restaurant.

Weekend brunches here are great.  I love the location and is friendly for the whole family.  The outside patio is open and has oversized games like Jenga and Connect Four to play.  Great drink menu and food as well!

Me and my husband really liked this place. It has a nice vibe, we both were saying how it would be a nice place to bring out of town guest. The food we had was delicious too, I had the watermelon tomato stack salad, absolutely delicious and so refreshing for this Summer heat. My husband had the best tasting chicken and waffles made of cornbread and bits of fresh corn with the most flavorful gravy with bacon (just put the diet aside for this, Lol). We also shared the lemon meringue pie in a jar, yummy. My husband had a beer he really liked that had a fruit flavor to it and I had a watermelon mojo that was good too. Our food suggestions were, thanks to our awesome waitress Kaila, she was really helpful. I just love a well informed server when it's your first time at a new place (this is especially since my husband can take awhile to figure out what he wants, Lol!). So Kaila saved my tummy, she was so enthusiastic with her suggestions on the food my husband could make a quicker than usual decision. All I can say, is that you won't be disappointed if you stop by, and yes we'll be back.
The food was pretty tasty. Had the Dragoon Short Rib over priced. The bartenders are all KUHL. We will be going back for sure.  I approve this message JK KUHL...

They have the worst service ever ! Had to ask 4 different workers just to get a salt shaker . The waitress looked extremely bothered every time we asked her for anything, especially when we asked for split checks, she even laughed when we asked. She never came by to check on us and we had to ask for drink refills multiple times before we ever received our drinks and she blamed it on the bar saying they were extremely busy when there was no one at the bar. And the bottomless drinks aren't bottomless you only are allowed 4. Hated it . Will never return.
Food decent. Prices decent. Good beer. Ok mixed drink options. The it place right now.  Very friendly staff and servers.

Brussel sprouts and farro salad with scallops was on point. The lemon meringue was outstanding like I'll probably have dreams about it.  I loved my Crushed Velvet cocktail.  Overall a bomb outdoor patio. Fantastic service.  Cool vibe. I'll definitely be returning.

Awesome place ! We got here just in time for happy hour they have great apps ! They also make their tonic in house it was one of the best gin and tonics I have had . We ordered a bunch of apps and all split them. The bacon tatortots were great really crispy and still softer potato center great onion bacon flavor we also had the truffle fries they were the shoe string type great flavor also delicious we got the sliders and a margarita pizza the sliders were really tasty classic slider nothing fancy but they nailed it and the pizza was good too simple fresh ingredients . The bartenders here are real deal they have great drinks and I should have know from the in house made tonic that they could make just about anything . My wife knowing that I am a fan of the classic cocktail the Negroni asked our bartender if she could make one and without hesitation she said sure and it was great ! And topped with a dried cherry garnish !

After reading the reviews, I'm hoping we just caught them on a bad day. We got seated right away, server came by shortly. I didn't really understand her explanation of the menu or how the "rotation" choices worked but she did seem friendly. 
Our food cam out cold and the service was very slow. Took 15 minutes for drinks. It was 5pm and they were not that busy. 
There are many food options in Downtown Summerlin, we would probably choose to patron somewhere else next time.

I've always enjoyed Public School 702, the food, the atmosphere, the service and the people watching!!! I have now experienced something new, Their Brunch!!! W.O.W.!!! Our server Peter was Fantastic, On Point, Funny and on top gave us exceptional Service, not like a server, like another extension of our group!!! I recognized the Manager Mark who was our server the 1st time I ever came here and he remembered me, my party and what I had and that we played Beer-pong after!!! That attention to detail and service is one, but not the only reason I will continue to come to Public School 702...the Main Reason is the Bacon Cheddar Tots with Jalapeño Ketchup!!!

I LOve this place! The concept is so welcoming and relaxed. I'm here regularly, almost twice a week. The food is spot on, the cocktail and brew choices are beyond expectation. The experiences have been stellar with an awesome gregarious, engaging crew up until tonight. All it takes is one egregious experience to ruin it all. Never, and I emphatically stress NEVER get served by the bartender Lisa. I'm an industry professional so I've experienced both sides of the bar. I know everyone is entitled to a bad day but, this one "she's special."
Walk up to the bar, have a seat and have this bartender directly in front of you for a solid two minutes and see if she even acknowledges your existence. Where I sat was at the ice and the mixing station so she was 22-inches away from me. It took the bar back to approach  me and asked if I wanted the menu. Finally,  Grumpy looked at me and asked if I wanted to place an order. My reply, "Would you please fire up a Brick Chicken." She looked at me like I was an alien (the outer space kind). She looked so puzzled, I repeated the order by saying, "The Jidori Brick Chicken?" and pointing to the menu. You know what her response was? You know when someone has that look that they can't be bothered. It was that, with this reply, "Are you getting a drink?!" I was speachless because, last I checked, I'd rather get tipped for a $25 dinner than an $8 beer. She looked absolutely perturbed as if how dare me order food before a cocktail. I'm most likely going to retract this review after a few months just to make sure this establishment stays in check and not to cocky with their success. I wanted to twist the knife just a tad. I tipped my server when I moved to a table 55%. :-)
This place was really good. If you go, get the fried cauliflower, I crave it everyday!  We just had to wait a long time for a table, but it was still a great experience.

Really, really cool spot!  I met a friend at Downtown Summerlin since she hadn't been there.  We decided it was way too hot to hang out outside.  The mall was completely dead and we quickly realized everyone was in this restaurant!  It was happy hour time, but I had my 3-year-old with me so we couldn't order off of that menu since HH is only for the bar, obviously.

Buffalo cauliflower: yum!  I normally hate mayo-based sauces, but this had so much blue cheese in it that I kept dunking.

Grilled watermelon & tomato salad (more like a stack):  my favorite thing.  Very refreshing and flavorful with some sort of white cheese (it looked in the shape of white chocolate shavings...tasted like feta sort of, but can't confirm because the shape of the cheese shards confused me but they were good).  Plus balsamic and oil drizzle.  Loved this!

Chicken & waffles:  the waffle is chile cornbread!  Very yummy.  It said there was syrup on it, but I couldn't tell because the chicken was saucy and the cornbread was savory.  It was good, but I felt it needed more sweet syrup to give it a true chicken & waffles experience.

We almost got the fish & chips, but decided against it because my kid wanted it and it was on the kids menu.  We thought we could just try a bite of hers.  When the kids' meal came out, it was a ridiculously large bowl of fries, with 3 small pieces of the best fried cod I have ever had.  The texture of the coating was insane, and the inside fish was still perfectly cooked (I hate when it dries out and is over cooked).  We took one of my daughter's pieces and my daughter ate the other two.  She hardly ate any fries.  Then, she wanted more fish.  GREAT.  It was $8 for her meal, and I had to order more fish for her...but this time I said no fries regardless that I had to pay $8 again because it was just a waste!  

Other than being annoyed at spending $16 for my daughter to have enough fish & chips (our fault for taking one of her pieces), everything was great.  Very filling, indulgent meal.  Not expensive either.

Oh, and the service is great!  At least our experience.  Our server was a tad slow but it was busy in there so he had a bunch of tables I'm sure.  But even the servers who weren't ours were super friendly!  My daughter kept playing peek-a-boo with them since we were near the order-entry computer station, and every single one of the servers gave her attention and talked to her.  Very cool, I was impressed.

My wife thought the food was okay but ended up with food poisoning. She has been sick all night now I am home from work taking care of our boy. I would expect something better from a restaurant in downtown Summerlin. Go at your own risk.

Tried Public School for lunch today and our experience was fantastic! I'm sure it can be a little loud during meal hours, but we enjoyed the atmosphere and had a great meal. Their beer selections are on par and loved the Crispy Chicken Sandwich! Phenomenal service staff from hostess to our waitress Vanessa. If you want some solid beer recommendations - she's your girl! Great time, will be back to try more dishes and to explore the mixed drink concoctions.

This place is gross. Gross beer, menu changes all the time. The only good thing is the flank steak w mac and cheese but they top it w salt n vinegar chips and its salty as the dead sea. Everything is pretty gross here
I've been here twice now. Fun place to hang out with friends... Good food, but service was VERY slow on both visits. If they improve the service, I would give them the 5 stars.

Stopped in on a Sunday for brunch. Peter was awesome and on point throughout. If you're hopping around downtown Summerlin and want good food and a cold drink I recommend stopping at Public School - the only school I've never been thrown out of.

I  was exploring summerlin and saw this restaurant. Very cool decor and theme.  I had the breakfast burrito,  which was bland. I asked for hot sauce, no Mexican hot sauce available.  My friend had the chicken and waffles,  which was smothered in gravy,  also very marginal. Might be a fun place for drinks...

Public School 702 has the type of refined brand you'd expect from a chain restaurant, which it is, but manages to feel more like a small-scale, chef-driven spot thanks to a modern menu and great craft brews. As a gastropub, you'll find pub and bar fare that will hit the spot like bangers and mash consisting of snappy chicken and herb sausages and a hearty bacon brussels mash. Other top dishes include chicken wings with a crackly, crispy exterior; the adobo tacos that come with two roasted chicken and two short rib tacos; and the massive farro and brussels salad with pan seared scallops.

They serve brunch on weekends, too. Their French toast varies, but the blackberry lemon curd version I tried was equally sweet and tart. Even better was the fried jidori chicken and green chili cornbread waffles. Well seasoned with a thin, crispy crust, the chicken sat atop mildly spiced, savory waffles covered in a gravy full of bacon bits. Topped with a fried egg, the brunch version differs from the one on their regular menu which has more chicken and no egg.

Unfortunately, some dishes fall flat. I wasn't a fan of the broccoli or salt and vinegar chips in the mac and cheese. And, the grits in the shrimp and white cheddar grits dish was too soupy and runny for my liking.

Their beer list changes frequently, but they've had some great ones on the menu like Jommegang by Ommegang (a Belgian style dark ale) and Parabloa by Firestone Walker (a Russian imperial stout).

Service has been solid the few times I've gone, but the restaurant is so large, with a long rectangular layout, that you can see servers struggling to race to the bar to pick up drinks, race to the kitchen on the other end to grab food, and race back to the tables. I think all the servers act as food runners and bussers too so the amount of work they have to do isn't conducive to great customer service. It's an issue with management and the layout more than anything, but often reflects poorly on the servers.

Cabbed in from the strip with a couple of friends.   Well worth the fare.  The beer selection was phenomenal as was the cuisine.  The servers answered our questions and took care of every need quickly.  We had 4 appetizers and 3 dinners, all prepared to order and presented quickly.   One of the best places we've been to in the Vegas area.  Another plus is the proximity to Bear's Best Las Vegas.  Thanks Kyle and staff.

First time today and it went very well! Went around 230, wasn't busy, so we got seated quickly. Unfortunately we were too early for RECESS (love that)/happy hour.

Interior: very cute motif, loved the menu! 

Waiter: didn't catch his name but he had a ponytail and glasses, haha, but he was awesome! 
One thing though, although I LOVE the ketchup and sriracha dip that came with my food, he should have asked if I wanted regular ketchup or the ketchup & siracha, you know, just in case ppl wouldn't like the combination (but I mean... It's siracha! Jk... Maybe that's why he didn't ask..who'd reject such a thing!?) 

When I told him he should hook it up on more sauce, he did AND suggested a bbq mustard sauce that would go with my food but I thought it tasted better with my brother's pizza, but I appreciated his incentive.

Food: I got the Colorado Lamb Burger medium rare, omg. It melted in mouth. I thought it was delicious! Loved the savory from the lamb and the sweetness from the jam together. 

My brother got the pizza which I thought was okay. 

A friend got tortilla soup and sliders, didn't get to try the sliders but it looked dry and she said it was ok. I got a taste of the tortilla soup and the flavor was light where I've had tortilla soup blasting with flavors, I mean, it wasn't bad, but just not what I'm used to? 

Pro: They have dishes with kale, quino, and cauliflower, and other things if you're feeling something more healthier? I 'preciate that too :). 
+ they have a children's menu

Con: I kind of wish there were more selections for nonalcoholic drinks though, but I understand that it's more of a pub kind of thing, but I was craving strawberry lemonade or other fruity, carbonated drinks. I mean, since they do serve burgers, maybe shakes? Haha.
Valerie made our night the best night ever as our server. Very out going and most personable server I've had. Food was great and the draughts were on point

The place is super cool inside and the outdoor patio is going to rock once it's cool enough to sit out there. But this place has much to be desired. I love to go to happy hour and have drinks and then order food towards the end. We did not even order food because the service was so dang slow that getting a drink was near to impossible. The female bartender at the bar, Courtney, told me she was going to charge my Bill. She did, and she never gave us the drinks we were charged for. The people on my right ordered an appetizer and they were incorrectly charged - they were charged higher than the pricing on the menu. When they said something to Courtney she said "oh the menu prices have changed. " so shouldn't that mean that the menu prices on the menu should have changed? The person on the left ordered something off the menu and Courtney said, "we don't have that anymore." Didn't they just open? So how could you have something on the menu that they no longer even serve? How could there be three different sets of people sitting at the bar all given wrong prices and wrong orders!?. Happy hour beers are small. I can't comment on the food since we never ordered it because we knew it would take too long to get it. We went somewhere else to eat.  This place is never going to make it if they don't get their stuff together.
The food is affordable, fresh and most importantly delicious!! Love it here and I love the outdoor giant games!

I would typically NEVER give a 5-star review, even if I was really impressed by a restaurant or server, but I strongly feel this place deserves it. Being a beer lover, I was stoked about their selection of craft beers on tap. My server Colby (like the cheese, lol) was very knowledgable about the food and drinks and sold me a Dawn of the Red brew that I really loved while I chowed down on ahi wanton tacos--also delicious. I would have never considered putting ahi in a crispy wonton but it was magic. Despite the fact that I'm a beer loyalist, they had such an interesting selection of craft cocktails I had to indulge while I was finishing up my meal. Colby said that the crushed velvet was very popular so I gave it a try. Nice refreshing take on a Moscow mule. The fresh lavender was nice touch. I can't wait to go back and work my way through their great tap selection, and I'll definitely ask for Colby's section because I've never had such great service at a casual concept.

First timers today at PS 702! The food was delicious! Great ambiance and very clean restaurant. We started with the speck and eggs and the bacon cheddar tots with sriracha ketchup. Both were good. The speck and eggs didn't have a lot of flavor so I found myself dipping a lot. Then we moved on to lunch I got the green chili soup of the day it was amazing a little spicy but we'll made. My husband got the American burger which does not come with cheese heads up! An American burger with no cheese WHAT!?!? So he added American cheese go figure :) my sons shared a kids cheese pizza and let me tell you it was huge. So parents if you want to save a little money since the restaurant is pricey order 1 kids cheese pizza for all the kids it really is that big!!! 

 I gave a 4 star review instead of a 5 for a couple of reasons. One my husband is a soda drinker and it is not complimentary refills! He was not happy about that! They only have bottled soda! That just isn't right especially when they do have spicy foods! The second reason I took away a star is because the food took a while to come out and I mean 30 minutes! For a medium cooked burger, cheese pizza, and a cup of premade chili to take 30 minutes is just ridiculous. I feel like there is no excuse for that especially on a saturday for brunch when they should be properly staffed. Other then that the restaurant was great and our server was pleasant. We will be back my husband fell in love with the burger and skinny fries! 

Little tip for all you craft beer lovers they have an epic list!

Freekin awesome.   We went for lunch.  We got an appetizer of hummus. The chick peas in it were amazing. The bread was soft and doughy.  I got roasted chicken salad it was delicious too. Chicken was perfectly cooked and dressing great too.  We shared Nutella cookie. Omg.  It was one of the best deserts I've ever had :)

I like this concept of Public School but think it needs to be fine tuned. The food is ok. I tried about half of the dinner menu and I'd say my favorite was the cheddar bacon tots or the buffalo cauliflower. The pizza was mediocre at best and the wings and chicken fingers were extremely salty. My favorite thing I've gotten here was the Earl Grey Juniper cocktail (gin based) it was yummy! Aside from those, the food and service were just average.

Tried the American Burger. Nothing special, just your standard, typical burger you'd find in any ole restaurant. Fries were lacking and soggy. Hubby got the crispy chicken sandwich w/kale salad. If you like blue cheese, get the salad. If not, it overpowers the salad. Hubby's sandwich had a decent spicy flavor to it, but it was nothing special. Also tried ahi tuna tacos to start. The dressing was nice and tart, but I would prefer it on a salad, not to flavor ahi. The ahi itself, being raw was a bit fishy w/no flavor other than its fishiness.  I like Downtown Summerlin, but Im not interested in coming back to Public School 702.

Went there to meet friends and former customers for an informational/fun meeting with daughter. Friday during Happy Hour. Bar section looked fun and was busy. Went to main dining room. Wine and beer selection very good, not a great deal of choices, but top notch names and well balanced. One of the few that carry Sorachi Ace from Brooklyn Brewery.

Appetizers were nice. Meat and Cheese board was interesting, but found it awkward to share. Meat were sliced thinly tangled together in a ball making it difficult to take a piece without touching the stack. Cheese was awesome but just small crumbles. Could be an excellent, but not for business meeting, great for couple. Calamari was good, excellent choice of 3 different sauces.  Tuna Poke was ok.

Dining room got to loud to carry a conversation without some serious projection. Needs some acoustic work for sure. 

Service was very good!

I have mixed reviews about Public School 702. There were some stand out dishes, but there were also dull ones as well. 

The Wild Mushroom and Taleggio Pizza is a MUST! I'm sold on anything with truffle oil, and if you feel the same I highly suggest ordering this. I can't wait to go back for this! 

The Crispy Buffalo Cauliflower is great as well! Loved the bleu cheese aioli sauce that it's paired with.

Now moving on to the things I wouldn't order again. The Speck and Eggs weren't that great. A little too salty if you ask me. Also, the Ahi Tuna Poke tasted off. I didn't think it paired well with the passion fruit. If you like fruity tuna poke, then maybe this is the dish for you, but it wasn't for me. 

Would I go back to Public School 702? Yes! I would go back just for the pizza and cauliflower. It was THAT good! Other than that, Public School 702 was mediocre. If you're confused by my review, I told you at the very top that I had "mixed reviews."

My friend and I had brunch here for his birthday and it was great! Our servers name was Chris I believe, and he was very attentive and good about giving us space but still checking in enough to see what we needed. Love the bottomless mimosas!!! Definitely recommend!
My boyfriend and I went here for dinner, missed happy hour but had a good time. Good food, kinda pricey.

Fried Cauliflower is awesome 
Need to have the Ahi Tuna Tacos every time I come. 
Fig and prosciutto pizza is amazing. 

The beer menu is pretty good, the rotating drafts are even better. Try a new beer that you've never had, don't stick with the same old cap. Expand your horizons! Don't order coors, bud, Miller, shock top, or blue moon here, try their other beers! You might find something you like!

For starters, we made a reservation for a group to sit on the patio. When we got there, they said we would have to wait 2 hours to sit on the patio, so we ended up sitting inside. What was the point of making a reservation, if we needed to wait 2 hours? Our waitress was inattentive and mediocre at best. We tried to order drinks, but they didn't have most of what we wanted. What bar in Las Vegas doesn't have Red Bull, Belvedere vodka, Captain Morgan and fireball? We ordered the naked wings and requested ranch dressing, but they said they never have ranch dressing. 

The empty glasses kept accumulating on our table as we ordered round after round of drinks. She never took the empty glasses away. Our waitress disappeared for a long periods of time, even though they weren't really even that busy. When we asked for our checks at the end of the meal, they were all incorrect.  

In the ladies restroom, there was a complete mess. There was no toilet paper in the stalls and the floors were messy. When we left the restaurant, I told the hostess. She asked me if anybody vomited in the restroom. She made it sound as if a lack of vomit on the floor, made all the rest of the mess acceptable.

Went here for brunch because we heard so many good things. Upon arrival there was a wait time for sitting outside so we went to the bar. Ordered the unlimited mimosas (of course) There was so much pulp in the orange juice though that it kept sticking to my lips and it was very uncomfortable, I was constantly wiping my lips like I had OCD. Then my friends second mimosa was a completely different color than mine. It had a pink hue to it but we couldn't get the bartenders attention to ask him about it. When we were paged for our outside table, we had to wait around the bar with many attempts at trying to get a hold of our bartender so we could move to our table. Finally, a barback noticed us and helped us out. There were no actual brunch items for vegans, in fact, the only thing I could order was the hummus. It was decent but tasted odd with orange juice. Not sure what the hype is about this place, I wasn't impressed.
Came for my birthday brunch and it was delish! Peter did an awesome job keeping those bottomless mimosas full, and we'll definitely be coming back for more of the Buffalo cauliflower!

Im still on the fence.  I like the school theme concept.   From the actual menus to the entrees, the school theme is consistent.   I ordered the hummus/ babaganoush/chick pea appetizer to share.  Plenty of pita bread....they will bring you as much as you want, which if you are watching your carbs,  may not be a good idea.  The dips were ok, dont think ill order again.  For my entree I had the kale Caesar salad.  Didnt love seeing 2 sardines staring at me when they sat the salad in front of me, but I scooted them to the side.  It was a good amount of salad, but again not sure id order it again.  Id like to go back and try some other options....ill keep you posted.

One of my least favorable experiences i have had here.   I got a steak ordered it medium and got a rare steak.  I tried to eat it, sent it back just asking if they could put it on a for another minute.  All they did was burn the outside.  Great now i have a burnt steak thats raw in the middle.  I just didnt eat it or complain further.  When i asked for my check with a full uneatin steak there were no questions and my waitress decided to sit at the POS station playing grab ass with some guy who worked there kissing her neck and whispering in her ear while i sat there waiting to pay for my uneaten raw piece of meat.  It'll be awhile before i return.  Cauliflower app is good.

Being a positive person I always look for the good in things. Positives are Public School is a cool idea (Grade A+). Cafeteria style seating indoors, but noisy (Grade B) and outside is a large patio with lots of space to enjoy(Grade A). But that's where it ends. Service was okay at best (Grade C) , yes they were polite and positive (Grade B). The kitchen slowed them down and what they served was nothing I would be proud to turn in (Grade D). Overall I'd give Public School a  grade of (C). To stand out in  Downtown Summerlin Pubic School needs to take some extra credit and study a little harder.

Went to Public School 702 the day after Christmas. A few friends and I went out for late dinner and were suggested to try the Chorizo Mac and Cheese and Shrimp and Grits. They were both phenomenal. The shrimp and grits is one of the most amazing dishes I've ever had. Perfectly cooked shrimp, amazing plating...kudos to the chef. I'll be back for more!

-Chris Chan
Public school obviously showed how basic the service and food is. Invest your money in private school people, lol!

They have a large beer menu. Some of the menu changes every week while the major beers are always available. I've been here 4 time now and I sit outside every time. Describing the outside seating area as humungous is an understatement. It just keeps going and going... 
Since public school 702 is on the second level u get a very nice view of downtown summerlin. It's also located at the prettiest spot next to the big water sculpture and cactus gardens. 
The view is cool but the jumbo sized games are the best reason to sit outside. They have a huge version of connect 4 and Jenga along with beer pong. 
On my last visit we tried the pbj burger sliders which were fairly good. The meat was a little drier than we liked but the bacon was good and peanut butter and jelly on a burger is better than it sounds.
Our waitress was fantastic.

Cool little spot in Downtown Summerlin. We went on a Friday around 7:00 to go play a game of beer pong outside. The outside sitting area is really chill and there were a ton of people having happy hour drinks. It took about 10 minutes to get a drink waiting at the bar. Bartenders just didn't seem to have any sense of urgency. Beer pong was fun, but you have to drink their house pilsner which is the worst. You have no option to change or upgrade/downgrade your beer. Because of that, we only played one game and high tailed it out to Red Rock for some gambling.

What a fantastic place to dine. The food was great and the service by Jaimie was even better! Will definitely go back since we are new to the area.The buffalo cauliflower and the cheese board were wonderful suggestions by Jaimie and the chorizo Mac and cheese was quite a surprise. Just go and try it, you won't be disappointed!

I'm very impressed with this place just opening up! Husband and I were seated immediately and our waitress, Christina, came over shortly after.
